column1: full to start, a bit of outswing outside off. Driven firmly to backward point
length ball swinging away in the corridor, left alone
and again, hits the fuller side of a good length outside off and gets it to shape away late. Left alone
straighter this time, gets it to hold its line towards middle stump. Defended into the on side
back of a length, fourth-stump line, left alone
fuller now, a bit of shape away. Nice stride forward to drive to the left of mid-off, who makes a good diving stop. Mid-off is wide, almost at extra-cover
short, a bit of width. Not the greatest start. Masakadza stands tall and cuts hard. Backward point dives left to stop it
back of a length, angling down leg, shapes to glance and leaves it in the end, forcing Dickwella into a tumble to his left
back of a length, wide enough outside off for Nigel Llong to signal wide
full, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Meets the ball nice and late, right under his eyes, to clip through square leg
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended into the cover region
short and wide, and this time he places his cut far enough to the left of backward point to pick up four

ooh. This one is back of a length, not as short as the previous ball, and Masakadza ends up trying to punch with an angled bat, away from his body. Thick inside edge bounces into the pitch and rolls backwards, not a long way from off stump
fullish on off stump, defended to mid-on
full outside off, a hint of swing away, left alone
good-length outswinger, fifth-stump line, Chakabva leaves again
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended into the ground and it bounces towards short leg
fullish, angling in towards off stump and curling gently away. Defended nice and close to the body, into the off side

draws the edge finally, excellent length and it's just slightly wider than the previous ball. Doesn't get fully forward to it, and ends up pushing away from his body in defence. Softens his grip upon impact, though, and it drops well short of second slip
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to wide mid-off
back of a length outside off, left alone
a touch fuller than the previous one, Masakadza leaves again
straightens his line and gets it to nip past Masakadza's defensive shot to hit pad. Probably going down leg. Nice length, trapped him on the crease

another appeal. This one's a touch fuller, pitches outside off, and nips in. Sri Lanka have reviewed Llong's not-out decision. Masakadza pressed forward, but not a big stride in defence. He's still on the move, and his bat is slightly behind pad while he plays this. Looks like pad first... Is he struck in line? Is it maybe slightly high? Umpire's call on impact, and umpire's call on projected path - ball-tracking says it'll clip the top of the off bail
goes back to one that isn't particularly short. Back and across to defend from an off-stump line towards short midwicket
fullish outswinger, fourth-stump line, defended into the point region
length ball shaping away in the corridor, left alone
length ball straightening away in the fifth-stump channel. Chakabva leaves
length ball, hits the deck fairly hard outside off and gets some extra bounce. Defended nice and late, with soft hands
a bit wider, left alone

ooh, excellent delivery. After all those outswingers, he gets this one to jag back off the seam, towards off and middle. Chakabva ensures his front pad isn't in the way, and jams his bat down hurriedly to squeeze it away through square leg
back of a length, close to off stump, punched towards point
back of a length, angling into off and middle, defended towards mid-on
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
short, only gets up to chest height, and not at great pace. Pulled away to the right of deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended to mid-off. Seemed to stop on the pitch slightly
back of a length on off and middle, punched to mid-on
back of a length, shaping away from a fourth-stump line, left alone
length ball, a little closer to off stump, defended into the point region

well played. That's a good-length ball, angling in slightly - it would probably have shaved but missed off stump. He steps across, lets it come on, ascertains there's no swing away, and clips to the left of long leg
and again. A touch shorter, on off stump, clipped away through backward square leg
length ball angling into off stump, clipped away through backward square leg
length ball, nips in slightly towards middle and off, and that's a good quick single. Lets it come on, closes his bat face at the last moment to tuck it to the right of that man at square leg
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped into the short fine-leg region
ooh, beauty. Turn and bounce, after dipping onto a beautiful length on middle stump. Presses forward to defend and he's beaten comprehensively

bowled him, and that's an absolute beaut. The arm ball - it drifts in and continues on along that trajectory after pitching. Not the greatest shot from Chakabva - it was dipping onto a good length, nowhere near full enough to be driving away from his body like that. Big gate, and Rangaiah bursts through it. Hang on - just watched the replay, and he was actually looking to whip that from off stump, against non-existent turn, through midwicket.
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
floated up, drifting in towards off stump, defended into the on side
fired in flat and full, angling into middle stump. Keeps his front pad out of the way to defend
back of a length close to off stump, punched towards backward point
length ball angling into middle and off. Keeps his front pad out of the way, shows the full face, and punches towards mid-off
length ball close to off stump. Starts by angling in towards middle and off and straightens away slightly. Defended to mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away through midwicket
shortish outside off. Not quite short enough to cut or punch, and he drags a half-front-foot, angled-bat slap through cover, off the bottom half of the bat
length outswinger, sixth-stump line, left alone
flat, angled into the pads, goes on the back foot to whip through midwicket
tossed up full, drifting in towards off stump. Defended into the covers. He's making sure that front pad is out of the way

he still manages to hit that pad. This one's angled in from wider of the crease, and it drifts and goes on with that angle. Beats the inside edge of the defensive prod by a long way, but it's going down leg
angling down leg again, this one's paddled away fine

oh man, he's asking so many questions. Off the mark in Test cricket, Musakanda, with an inside-edge squeezed down to fine leg. Beautiful length, close to off stump, and he attempts to drive with the turn but there's no turn
down the track, gets to the pitch of this flighted one and drives firmly to mid-off
back of a length, close to off stump, stands nice and tall and defends into the covers
fullish outside off, good stride forward to drive to the left of wide mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards mid-off
good, sharp bouncer. Rises steeply over leg stump, and Masakadza leaves it nonchalantly. Just steps across to the off side and dips his left shoulder
fullish, a bit of outswing in the corridor. Nice stride forward to push gently into the cover point region

bouncer outside off, and that's fortunate for Musakanda. His first Test run was off the inside-edge, and his first boundary off the outside edge. Looks to hook and only manages a top edge that flies away to the fine leg boundary. Long leg a little too wide to get to that
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
dangerous. Looks to sweep from the stumps, or close to it. Too full for it, and he's lucky this goes with the angle - was headed down leg
another big appeal. Another one that slides on with the angle as he presses forward to defend, and he just about gets a little squeeze of inside-edge onto it. Going down leg too.
more flight, fuller, outside off, driven to short extra-cover

lovely flight and drift, and Masakadza has to go. Presses forward to defend, ends up playing outside the line because of that delicious inward drift, and inside-edges into his pad. Short leg takes a good catch tumbling forward
full on off stump, defended from top of off stump, he went over the wicket for the left hander
short outside off stump and the batsman punches the ball towards cover
full outside off stump, driven to cover. Full face of the bat, a confident shot even if that was no runs
short and rising, the batsman bends his knees to get under the ball and the keeper Dickwella has to collect that from above his head

length ball outside off and Kumara is appealing!, a faster ball that hurries the batsman and the ball goes past his outside edge. Sri Lanka review. There was a slight sound while the straight drive was played, not sure if that's a slight edge or just the whooshing noise of the bat's stroke. The third umpire is using that rock-and-roll feature to determine that. Yes, slight edge.. Umpire Gould changes his decision, and the debutant has to go.
good length on middle stump, the ball angles away from the left hander, who lets it go past to the keeper
full outside off, defended off the front foot, brings his front foot out and plays that along the ground
defends the full ball outside off again
full outside off again, slower ball and defended again
full outside off stump, defended with soft hands
full on middle and he nudges it on the leg side, short leg does well to  release that ball back quickly. A direct hit may have brought in the third umpire into play
good length that pitched on middle stump, the ball angles away from Williams' poking bat, goes past his outside edge
good length pitches on middle stump, punched off the back foot towards point

short on middle but the angle of the bowler's release gives the batsman just enough width to free his arms, punches it off the back foot after rocking back deep, races away to the boundary in front of point
very full and pitches wide outside off stump, squeezes the ball out, dribbles towards point
short and pitches outside leg stump, the batsman ensures he gets out of the delivery's way
once again he brings out the short ball, pitches on middle and goes past the batsman from next to his face, he sways and lets that go past him
good length outside off stump and that ball slides past the batsman's defense, the ball had rip but it did not turn
full on middle stump and he brings out the reverse sweep, he can't time it well and it goes between the keeper and first slip, an unconvincing shot for four
good length on off stump, mis-times it towards the leg side in front of short leg
full outside off , pushed to the cover region
good length outside off stump, slight spin into the left hander, defends it with an open face towards point
good length outside off stump, fourth-stump line, a back-foot defense that sees off the over
pitches full on middle, the batsman defends it from top of off stump, the ball races away to point region but that area is heavily covered
full on middle stump, he defends the ball on the front foot, ensures his eyes are always on the ball

full outside off, a front foot defense that is hit back to the bowler. Kumara does well to grab that on his followthrough, and there's aggression! He throws that back at the stumps and breaks it. He appeals but it seems like he's the only one interested
good length on middle stump, plays that with soft hands towards mid off and the batsman run through for a single
full on middle stump, defended confidently to cover off the front foot

short on middle stump and Williams cuts it over gully for four. It was a tad too close to be cut but he got enough on that shot for the ball to race away for four. A little less elevation and he could've been a gone-r
full outside off stump and he races down the pitch to negate the spin (if any), no turn and it hits his outside edge and goes past the bowler
full outside off stump, defended firmly on the front foot
quicker ball outside off stump, no spin after pitching, Williams is forced to hurry into that defence
leans into that shot with the cover drive, that was pitched up and outside off stump, a controlled shot between cover and square mid off, runs away
full and wider outside off stump, defends it away from his body to cover region

good length outside off stump, the batsman rocks back and tries to defend that, finds the outside edge and races away to the vacant area fine of third man, they think of two and they take it. Third man was too square
starts off around the wicket, full on middle and leg, nudged to the leg side in front of square
full on off stump and this one straightens after pitching, defended tentatively off the front foot
outside off and the batsman paddles that onto the leg side to fine leg, they walk through for a single
full on leg stump and it's drifting past the batsman's pads, worked to the leg side to fine leg once again
short and quicker this time, there's an empty region behind the square leg keeper, the clips that off his pads and short leg has a lot of work to do to retrieve that from the deep
good length outside off stump, defended back past the bowler off the back foot
tossed up outside off stump, the batsman gets to the pitch of that delivery and defends it to mid on
full outside off stump, the batsman defends it to point but he's off-balance
full on off stump and the batsman was prepared for that, he displays all three stumps but also manages to execute that reverse sweep perfectly. Goes past the point fielder for four
full outside off stump, defended towards cover
full and quick outside off stump, he hits that back to the bowler, Herath almost caught that in front of him but drops just in front
full outside off stump, front-foot defence towards mid on
flat delivery outside off stump, brings out the back-foot defence
good length on off stump, the batsman clips that off the back foot in front of square on the leg side into the gap
good length on middle stump, the batsman swipes that towards the square leg umpire's direction. There's a fielder there too
full outside off stump, Williams pushes the ball back to the bowler

full outside off and he looks to sweep that into the vacant square leg region. Finds the top edge, instead. The extra bounce does him in and finds the top edge of his sweeping bat, Gunaratne runs to short fine leg and pockets that.
good length outside off stump, sharp turn away from the left hander's poking bat, the keeper collects
full on middle stump and Raza charges down the wicket, gets to the ball's pitch and smacks that high back past the bowler's head, clears the boundary with ease
full on middle stump and the batsman gets his stride in front and paddles the ball fine behind him to the leg side, the fine leg fielder is square
full on middle stump, races down the pitch and works it to the leg sideto the right of mid off, goes just past short mid wicket who was diving to his left
full outside off stump and the batsman gets to the pitch of the ball and bunts it back to long on
full on middle stump, defended firmly back to the bowler
good length outside off stump, the batsman goes deep into his crease and mis-times a cut, the ball goes in front of cover
good length on middle stump, punches it off the back foot to the left of mid on
bowls this from closer to the stumps, good length on middle stump, Raza was quick to get on the back foot and clips it towards square leg
full on middle stump and Ervine gets on top of that ball and defends it
full on middle stump and Ervine misses his front foot defence. Smacks his pad but it was going down leg anyway
full-pitched on off stump, front-foot defence
good length on off stump, no spin and Ervine rocks back to punch that ball to long off
full and the ball's drift outside off is defended off the front foot
good length on middle stump, glanced to the leg side
full on middle and off, brings out his stride and paddled behind square to fine leg for a single
full outside off stump and Ervine drives that back to the bowler
flatter ball, good length outside off stump, defended
quicker ball that's very full on middle stump, clips that off his boots to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
full on middle stuff, firmly defended back
drifts in on middle stump, good length ball that is punched off the back foot to the bowler
full outside off and Ervine paddles that from outside the off stump to the leg side, goes to fine leg
what a glorious shot, he was a tad off-balance but he sweeps that well anyway, full outside off and smacked for four
full outside off stump, defended
good length outside off stump, a faster ball that Raza charges to but it's too close to his body for any attacking shot, defends it back to the bowler. There was intent, though
short on middle stump, mis-times a punch towards mid wicket
good length that pitches on middle, the natural angle takes it away from the left hander, he gets his bat out and the outside edge races to third man
short but slower, on middle stump and it took ages to get to Raza, he jumps thinking it's going to be short but it stays low, mistimes it towards the leg side
shorter ball and this one rises over the batsman who was ducking. He gets out of the way of the delivery but there's not enough carry. Bounces in front of the keeper
good length that Raza whips off his pads to the leg side
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to cover
good length on fourth-stump outside off, driven past the mid off fielder
full on off stump, defended firmly to the bowler
full on off stump, the tossed up delivery is driven to the left of the long on fielder, Herath has to put in some effort
drift in the air, good length outside off stump, defended
slower and drifting, full on off stump, Raza does not bite the cherry, defended
good length and wider outside off stump, the ball spins into Raza who mis-times a back-foot punch on the off side
good length on middle stump, punched from top of off stump but finds the mid off fielder
short outside off, no width on offer though. Gets behind the line of the ball and defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, driven back past the non-striker but mid on is there for that shot
short on middle stump and the batsman swivels to pull that down the ground to fine leg
short but outside off, Raza safely lets that ball go past him
good length outside off stump, defended hurriedly off the back foot. And that's lunch.
good length that pitches on middle, the batsman lets that angling ball go past him
good length on off stump, that nagging length that forces an unsure shot from the batsman, he looks to poke at it but the ball goes past him
good length outside off stump and a perfect cover on the up, times it well and it races away to the boundary, a mix between a punch and a cover, really
good cricket, full on middle and he drives it back past the bowler towards long off, safe batting
good length that pitched on off stump, defended from top of middle on the front foot
full on off stump, the batsman walks across the stumps and clips it on the leg side from waist high
good length outside off stump, no spin and defended with an open face on the off side
tossed up and fuller on middle, defended back to the bowler on the front foot
good length on off stump, the ball straightens after pitching, a back-foot punch towards mid on yields runs
good length that pitches just outside off, defended to the off side
good length just outside off stump, whipped to the leg side but the midwicket fielder is placed there for that shot,
good length on middle, brings out the front-foot defence.
full outside off stump, he's more than happy to let that ball go past him. Too close for a cut, too short for a drive
good length on middle stump and the batsman smashes that into the pitch with a back-foot defence
good length outside off stump and there's enough width for a punch to the sweeper cover fielder
good length that angles into the batsman's body, worked towards the leg side from top of off and middle

good length outside off and he gets into position very early. He pulls that with authority and it goes in the gap near midwicket. Slight turn of his bat while pulling that but enough in that shot for a boundary
short just outside off stump, Raza lets that go through to the keeper
good length outside off stump, backs away and cuts it towards point
good length pitching on middle and Raza puts his dancing shoes on. Defends it and hurries back
charges once again, picks up the full ball from off stump and slogs it to the left of short mid wicket.
full on middle and now Ervine gives it the charge. The ball is a straighter one, to deny room, all it manages is to dribble to the leg side

was that a chance?, a hint of turn on good length from middle stump and it's in the air after the batsman whips it off his pads. But it's to the left of the short leg fielder Kusal Mendis, goes past his right before he could even react
full on middle stump, defended
good length outside off stump, the natural angle comes into the left-handed Ervine, punched back past the bowler to mid off
good length wide outside off, cut with power but it's too close to his body. Finds one of the three fielders on the off side behind square
fuller and outside off, driven well to deep cover, third man has to cover a big distance, but he does well to mop up
full on middle stump, clips it in front of square and they batsmen scamper through for a single
full outside off stump, he defends it from top of off. Flies to the short midwicket fielder
finishes the over with a bouncer, enough pace in that and the batsman chooses to let that go. Ducks under the rising ball
full outside off stump and Ervine dances down the wicket to smash that over mid off for four. Saw the flight, got to the pitch of the ball and hammered it. Perfect
changes the length now, full on middle this time, defended to short leg
full on middle and he flicks it with power to the leg side, just misses the short leg fielder
full on off stump, defended to cover
full outside off stump again, the incoming angle works well  for the left hander who defends that
good length and wide outside off, Ervine reckons he can make some room and cut that. He gets that room by rocking back but finds the cover point fielder
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot and the non-striker calls for a run. Raza takes off anyway and it can be close. Point races in to field that but the throw is a few inches off
good length on leg stump, punches it from top of off to mid off. The batsmen race through for a run. Much better communication this time

short outside off and Raza gets on his toes and punches it between cover and point. Exquisite shot that fetches him a couple. A little bit more power would've gotten him four. A nominee for shot of the day
full and wide, slashes at it, no foot work on that and the ball races past point. Efficient but not elegant at all. Backward point has to clean that up from third man region
full on middle stump, the batsman defends it back to the bowler. Good pace
good-length ball that is defended from outside off stump, enough pace in that for the ball to run down to the sweeper fielder on the off side
short, just a bit of width, stands tall, makes a bit more room, and slashes it away to the left of backward point
fuller now, a little bit of drift in towards off stump. Defended to short extra-cover
short again, on off stump, opens up at the hips and just dismisses that. Swats it away cleanly over midwicket
flattish length ball outside off, defended to short extra-cover
full on middle stump. Mid-on is a little deep and he pushes gently to him and picks up a single that takes him to fifty. Started circumspectly, but now he's really opening up
back of a length on leg stump. Goes deep in his crease to work this through square leg
length ball angling in towards off stump. Punched to the right of deep point
fullish, angling into off stump. Not much of a front-foot stride in defence. Was aiming towards mid-off, I think, but ends up playing this to mid-on, off the inside half of the bat

length ball, fourth-stump line. Defended back to the bowler. Again, the shortness of the front-foot stride meant the round-the-wicket angle forced him to play it straighter than he wanted. Aimed into the covers
back of a length outside off, the inward angle cramping him slightly for room. Slashes and misses, no footwork there
bouncer over off stump. Bends at the knees and gets into a hurried crouch to evade it
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Clipped to midwicket
Lax footwork there, just stuck in the crease to a quickish length ball on middle and off. Opens his bat face and defends into the point region
down the track to the flighted one on off stump, drives to deepish mid-off
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
floated up fuller, drifting across the left-hander towards off stump. Driven back to the bowler
length ball sliding with the angle from middle to off. Defended back down the pitch with the full face showing
a touch too straight, clipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
fullish on middle stump, clipped through square leg
short outside off, and that's a superb shot, stands up tall and punches firmly through cover. Deep point is far too square to be able to stop it
back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump. Watches it well and pushes into the covers with a slightly open face
goes deep in his crease, back and across, even before Kumara delivers. Ends up as a back-of-a-length ball angling across to off stump, and he defends into the off side
again that big back-and-across trigger movement. Full-toss at thigh height, on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
excellent length on off stump, defended into the covers
floats it up slower and Raza skips out. The ball drifts in a long way and hits his pad, after going past his attempted leg-side whip
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
full, speared across the stumps, nice controlled lap-sweep into the fine leg region

is that pad first? Nigel Llong thinks so. Presses forward to defend, playing for turn, and there is no turn. Bat comes down a little late, looked like it was behind his pad. Raza has reviewed... It looks like pad first to me, and then inside edge. Looks like it's in line with the stumps too. Umpire's call, and ball-tracking says it'll hit the inside of off stump, near the top. Classic Herath dismissal, draws level with Malcolm Marshall.
and a near-identical delivery to the one that dismissed Raza. Presses forward to defend, looking to play towards mid-off, and a thick inside-edge flies past short leg
full outside off, squeezed away to the left of deep point
length ball angling into middle and off. Stays on the back foot to defend to the right of mid-on
length ball angling into off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length, angling into off stump, lets it come on and defends right under his eyes
in the blockhole on off stump, jams his bat down to block towards mid-on
full on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
full on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
full on middle stump, gets the front pad out of the way to defend back to the bowler
fired very full outside off, almost a wide yorker, left alone
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to midwicket

ooh. Hung this up a little slower, angling into off stump with a low arm. Plays slightly outside the line in defence, not as much turn as he hoped for, and it drops down into the leg side off the inside edge
a bit fuller, on middle and off, defended into the on side. Bat came down at an angle against that, across his front pad
floated up, drifting in towards off stump. Nice stretch forward for the checked drive, and Chandimal dives right at short extra-cover to stop it
qucker and wider, pulls his length back a touch. Left alone
full, a little outside off, stretches out to defend
a bit flatter, slightly back of a length on off stump, leans back to chop it away through point
back of a length, turns in towards the pads. Goes on the back foot for a defensive clip into the on side
goes back to a fullish ball on middle and leg. Stays leg-side of the ball as well, and jams his bat down in defence
full on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
full on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler.
flighted ball on off stump, driven to deepish mid-off
floated up, angling across the left-hander and getting him to stretch forward and across to dab into the point region with an open face
flat, angling down leg. Misses the flick and that's a good take from Dickwella down the leg side
tossed up on middle and off, driven to deep mid-off - surely you want him up to save the single with the new man on strike?
tossed up outside off, Moor looks to sweep and misses. Ends up sneaking under his bat
flat length ball turning down leg. Is hit on the pad as he goes back and misses the flick
a hint of away-drift on off stump. Full, defended back to the bowler

beautiful delivery. Some more drift on that occasion, but it wasn't as full and it was dangled up a little wider. Reached out, well away from his body, to drive, and the ball slid past his outside edge. Dickwella has the bails off in a flash - did he drag his foot out of the crease at any point? They check with the third umpire. Tricky call with the bowler's front foot. Looks like a millimeter of heel has landed behind the line... He's only bowled one no-ball in Test cricket before this... Well, the third umpire rules that this is a no-ball too! Wow. I thought a tiny sliver of his heel had landed behind the crease
flat length ball turning towards leg stump. Goes on the back foot and clips to midwicket
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler. He's worried about the drift, so played that with the full face showing, resisted the temptation to flick it
a bit flatter and he goes back to defend back to the bowler

another excellent delivery from Herath, natural variation. The angle across the left-hander, a bit of drift away and a bit of dip. Had to play at it, but it didn't turn. Went with soft hands so the edge drops short of slip
flighted ball on middle stump, clipped into the on side
a touch shorter, goes back to punch to long-on
length ball on middle and leg, defended into the on side
tossed up slow on off stump, checked drive only goes as far as short extra-cover, where Chandimal dives right
shot. That's not a bad ball, dangled up just outside off, and he gets down low, quick feet, and slog-sweeps powerfully over midwicket
flat, a touch back of a length, angling into middle and off. Rocks back, opens up at the hip, whips to the left of mid-on
stays back to a fullish ball on off stump, defends back to the bowler after taking a small step across his stumps
a bit more flight outside off, slog-swept along the ground to deep midwicket
fullish length outside off, defended to short cover
this one's a bit wider. Long stride forward to drive to short cover
not a particularly short ball, but fairly wide. Goes deep in his crease and slaps to backward point
full on leg stump and drifting down the leg side
full outside leg stump once again, spins away from the right hander down the leg side
continues to bowl outside leg stump and this time the batsman lines up the sweep, connects with it well, but there's a fielder at sweeper in that region. Two quick runs
tosses it up, pitches on middle and he bunts it back to long on
full outside off stump, defended with authority
good length pitching on middle, defended back to the bowler from top of off stump
tossed up on middle stump, driven straight back to the bowler
good length pitches on middle and leg, spins into the batsman who punches it off his back foot to mid on
full and outside off this time, timed well - a gentle push - past cover region,
wide outside off stump, picks that up from outside the wickets anyway and slogs it to the sweeper fielder on the leg side

wide outside off stump and there's enough width for Ervine to cut that. Jumps onto that length with ease and cuts it late into the gap behind point. The sweeper tries hard but the ball beats him in the race. An easy shot for a set batsman
tossed up on middle, driven to mid on and the batsmen take off for a quick single. Comfortably in
full on middle, inside edges the whip onto his pads
full outside leg stump and swept with ease, gets to the ball's pitch early and turns that to fine leg
full outside off stump, defended but the ball jars back into his pads
full on middle and leg, the batsman is cramped for space, defended straight back
quicker, flatter ball this time. On the short side, and that lets the batsman rock back and punch that down the ground to long on
full on middle stump, driven to long on. The batsmen have enough time to walk through for a run
good length that angles away from the left hander, too close to Ervine's body and his punch finds the outside edge of the bat. Flies past the slip cordon's left and into the fine leg boundary
good length angling away from the left hander, he manages to punch that off his back foot, goes to the gap to the right of cover, sweeper mops up
short outside off stump, enough width offered to open the face of the bat. The ball runs across the carpet and to the sweeper fielder in the deep on the off side
very short and invites the pull from Moor. Steady head while playing that shot from top of off stump and the ball runs away to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
fuller delivery pitches outside off stump, driven away from his body to mid off
good length on middle stump, firm defence offered.
full and on off stump, defends the new bowler's first ball
full on leg stump, clipped away to fine leg, slight swing
full and wide outside off stump, front-foot defence
in the air, but wide of extra cover, that was tossed up outside off stump and the batsman went hard at that shot. Popped up in the air but falls safe
full on middle and off, defended off the front foot

in the air, again! and the new bowler strikes. It was in the slot to be hit, full and on middle. Moor makes a little bit of room and hits that straight down the ground. At first glance it seemed like a six off the bat but the more you waited, the more you realised that it was going to fall short. Holes out to long on. His bat turned while he tried to hit that. Kumara almost made a mess of the catch but positioned himself under it eventually
full and rising outside off stump, passes inches from the batsman's face. Waller does well to get out of the way
full on middle stump, tries the inside-out cover drive. Finds the cover fielder
good length outside off stump, defended authoritatively off the front foot. Straight to cover
good length pitching just outside off, defended from top off stump
wide outside off stump and that's an exquisite off drive. Goes between point and cover. A shame that only fetched him a single
slower ball and this one's full and a yorker, digs it out somehow and the ball flies off his bat to the sweeper fielder deep on the off side
full outside off stump, opens the bat's face and finds the gap between point and cover. And that's 200 for Zimbabwe
pitched up and that's overpitched, makes it a full toss by bringing his stride out and sweeps it with ease. Races away to the boundary behind square
slower this time, on leg stump and driven back to the bowler
short on leg stump, spins slightly into the right hander who was looking to make some room. Dribbles away to the off side
short and outside leg stump, whips it off his pads to the leg side
short and wide outside off stump and for Ervine, whose in his 70s, that's a freebie, really. He goes deep into the crease and pulls that ease over mid on. Easy peasy

good length outside off stump, opens the bat's face and punches that to the left of cover. The fielder has to race and retrieve that ball. Throws it well to Lakmal, who breaks the stumps off the throw but umpire Gould is stoic. Safely in
good length on middle stump that angles away from the left hander. Tries to jab at that shot but it's too close to his body, just passes his outside edge
full on off stump, driven to mid off
good length outside off stump, cut towards point. Too close to him

full on off stump and the batsman defends it back to the bowler. But there's more drama! Lakmal picks up the ball and aims it at the non-strikers stump. Misses the wickets but if that would've hit the stumps, the non-striker could've been in danger.
good length on middle, opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third man. And that's Tea.
tossed up full on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
shortish on off stump, makes some room to slap to the left of deep point
tossed up on off stump, defended back to the bowler
ooh, a little dangerous, but he picked his spot well and used his hands excellently. Reverse-sweep, off a middle-and-off-stump line, lots of bottom hand to place that wide of slip
goes back to a length ball that skids on towards middle stump, punches to cover point
tossed up on off stump, driven sweetly, inside-out, to the left of cover point. Overpitched that slightly, Herath, and Waller got a nice stride out and leant over it
starts with a short ball on off stump, pulled to the man at deep square leg
fullish outside off, driven with an open face to deep point
short, angling down leg, brings out the short-arm swat down to long leg
back of a length outside off, and that's lovely timing again from Waller. Stands up tall and punches to the left of the diving cover fielder
back of a length on off stump. Lets it come on and tucks it to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, gets on the front foot and punches on the up to the left of mid-off
there's that reverse-sweep again. Uses the angle Herath is creating from left-arm around, gets down low, meets it on middle stump, and swats it square, through point
flat, angling into off and middle, goes back to clip to midwicket
nicely flighted outside off. Invites the cover drive, but there's no turn and the ball rolls to mid-on off the inner half of the bat

well bowled. Flat, but still a good-length ball, and it turns in sharply enough to straighten from middle stump. Goes back when he should be forward, and it beats the inside edge of his defensive jab. Big lbw appeal, not given, not reviewed. Height may have been an issue? Ball-tracking says it's bouncing over middle and leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back to push into the point region
shot, but he'll have to be careful. Goes back and makes room to cut one that isn't particularly short, and goes with the angle towards middle stump. Can't beat backward point
length ball close to off stump, presses forward and defends towards backward point, who runs in quickly to cut off the single
full on off stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
back of a length, close to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches to deep point
bouncer over middle and off. Carries at over shoulder height to the keeper. Effort ball, rises steeply, and Ervine quickly sways his head away from the line, dipping his left shoulder
ooh, this is fiery stuff. Yorker now, so close to off stump. Jams down hurriedly and he cue-ends it into the ground, and it bounces up over the leaping keeper to take him to 99
back of a length, down the leg side, misses the flick off the hip
again, he rocks back to one that's sliding onto middle stump, but this one is definitely short, and he punches it away so sweetly to the right of backward point
tossed up on off and middle, blocked back to the bowler
dangled up slower on off stump, opens his bat face to steer through cover point
tossed up, floated across the left-hander, presses forward and across to defend

on middle stump now and he's quickly down low to paddle this around to long leg - sweeping on length rather than line - and bring up his second Test hundred. Well played! He hasn't given Sri Lanka a sniff. Made full use of excellent batting conditions, unlike some of his team-mates.
tossed up on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
bouncer angling across the left-hander. Drops his gloves low and lets it pass through to the keeper
appeal for lbw, that certainly struck in line with middle, but it pitched outside leg, I think. Fell over, trying to work that across the line, Nice length, but pitching a fair way outside leg

bouncer outside off, and Ervine picks up another slightly fortunate boundary against Kumara. Looks to pull, has to drag it from a long way outside off, only manages a top-edge that flies to the keeper's right

full on middle and off, shows the full face and just leans into the ball to send it racing away to the left of mid-off. Excellent timing, but this ball - and that lbw appeal earlier - seemed to be reversing slightly away from the left-hander
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
short outside off, gets up on his toes and steers it to the right of third man
tossed up on leg stump, lets it come on and uses the pace to tickle it into the fine leg region
floated up on middle and off, turns a little less than Waller expects as he aims a defensive jab into the off side. Rolls into the midwicket region off inside edge
tossed up a little wider, driven to short extra
flatter on off stump, defended towards cover point
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
full, a little wider and slower, opens his bat face to defend towards backward point
tossed up full on off stump, clipped through backward square leg
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Looks to go back and punch, and the ball keeps going with the angle to beat outside edge
beaten again, even better delivery this time. This one's slower, fuller. Brings Waller forward to defend and slides on past the outside edge
on the back foot this time to a slow length ball on off stump, punches through the point region
tossed up on leg stump, swept to long leg
ooh. Now Ervine plays for turn. Dips onto a good length outside off, reaches slightly away from his body to defend. No turn, and the inside-edge rolls into the leg side
full on off stump, blocked to midwicket

bowled him, that's poor technique from Waller. Really poor. Goes back to a flat length ball pitching on off and middle, playing for trajectory rather than length. And he doesn't get across with his back foot either. Ends up leg-side of the ball instead, and it rips past his outside edge and hits off stump. Staying leg-side of the ball has helped him score freely through point and cover point, but along comes a ball like this, and he's in trouble
length ball sliding into the pads, clipped into the backward square leg region
tossed up outside off, defended to midwicket
tossed up full on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
back of a length, fired flatter, goes with the arm along a fourth-stump line. Goes back and across to punch it back to the bowler
tossed up close to off stump, defended into the covers
a little closer to off stump, stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
down the track, wanted to maybe whip this from outside off through mid-on. A bit of drift away and he ends up whipping it hard, back to the bowler. Has to hurry back into his crease
flatter, goes deep in his crease and defends to short leg
flat length ball on off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to Dilruwan
flighted ball on middle stump, shows the full face to drive to long-on
flighted and full on leg stump, whipped to mid-on and they hurry through for one. Put pressure on the fielder, who fumbled a straightforward pick-up. Lakmal.
flighted ball outside off, clipped with the turn to long-on
tossed up, drifts in towards off stump, defended into the covers
goes back to a length ball sliding on to leg stump, whips to midwicket
tossed up wide of off, left alone
flattish length ball angling down leg, nudged into the fine leg region
nice flight on off stump, not quite fully forward to defend, and has to pull his front pad away as this spins in towards middle. Blocked back to the bowler
on the back foot this time as this spins in towards leg stump, clipped through square leg
flat, back of a length outside off, left alone
slightly round-arm, on the fuller side of a good length, angling in to off stump. Defended into the covers

lovely. Tossed this up slightly slower, and it dropped slightly shorter than the previous ball. Not close to the pitch of it in defence, and the edge falls just short of slip. Didn't push at it, to his credit
fuller, defended into the covers
full, speared in towards Cremer's feet. Shows the full face and defends towards mid-on
ooh, nearly. Slip flies to his right but the edge flies wide of him. Not quite short enough for the back-foot punch, and he only manages a thick outside edge
full on middle stump, blocked to midwicket
ooh. Gets this angling further in with some roundness of the arm. Doesn't spin as much as Cremer anticipates as he defends, and the inside edge flies wide of short leg
tossed up slower on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
a little flatter on off stump, goes back to defend
flat, back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to punch to short extra-cover
tossed up slow outside off, presses forward to block to short extra
ooh, excellent length, straightens slightly towards middle stump. Played slightly around his front pad to defend that towards midwicket
some flight now, outside off, driven to short extra
again, flight, but slower. Makes him stretch out to defend into the covers
drops this a touch short and he skips back to punch to deep point
back of a length, turning back in towards off stump. Goes back and across to work it leg side, can't beat short leg
down the track, can't quite reach the pitch of this flat one outside off. Clips to midwicket
floated up full outside off, defended back to the bowler
flat length ball on off stump, stays back to block back to the bowler
tossed up slow outside off, reverse-swept to the right of deep point

ooh, nearly. Drifts this in towards middle stump, at a fairly rapid pace. Not fully forward in defence, ends up playing outside the line and inside-edges, on the bounce, to short leg. That edge saved a possible lbw
tossed up outside off, stretches across to lap-sweep to short fine leg
fullish outside off, blocked to short cover
down the track and he floats this into his legs. Has to play around his front pad to meet it, gets an inside-edge down to short fine leg
back of a length, slanting across to middle stump. Defended off the back foot, into the on side
full on leg stump, clips into the leg side and there's a lot of noise from the close-in fielders. No wonder. Straight onto short leg's boot, then shin pad, and then just eludes his right hand
length ball outside off, stretches out to defend
drifts in on off stump, a full-length delivery that is defended with soft hands
full outside off stump, brings out a big stride and defends it
full outside off stump, the ball grips after pitching and goes away from the left hander. The keeper yelps a small appeal but no one else interested
full on leg stump and the batsman walks across and paddles it down fine leg. A wiiiide front-foot no ball
good length on leg stump, flicked on the leg side but short leg does brilliantly to stop that with one hand.
short on leg stump and he swivels to pull that in the deep on the leg side. There was enough width for that to be punished.
full on leg stump, punched to mid off
full outside off stump, puts his leg in the ball's line and defends it
full outside off stump and defended with ease off the front foot
drifts into the left hander and pitches outside off stump, brings out his stride and defends
flatter outside off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide outside off and Ervine pounces onto that. Cut away furiously to the sweeper cover fielder
full outside off stump, opens the bat's face and the batsmen take off. Lakmal at point seems to have hurt himself while trying to field that. He slipped
another no ball from Gunaratne, front-foot no ball despite a wide release, defended
full outside leg stump, clipped off his pads to the vacant gaps on the leg side
almost gone!, good length outside off stump that he looks to play on the up, through the shot too early and inside edges that shot inches away from his stumps
good length ball defended on short leg, he releases the ball early but misses the stumps
good length outside off stump, played back to the bowler

A beautiful ball from Gunaratne!, floated into the stumps from around the wicket, he tries the cover drive and the ball goes straight through Cremer's bat and pad. The ball clips just the top of the stumps. And he's got to go. The umpires have a look for the no-ball since Gunaratne has been guilty of that in the past. No, he's good this time. Cremer has to go.
full on off stump, solid defence back to the bowler
full on off stump, defended straight back to the bowler.
short outside off, enough width to cut that powerfully. Uses the depth of the crease but finds the only fielder placed at the deep on the off side
full on leg stump, clipped to short leg
faster one that angles away from the right hander after pitching on off stump, cut away with ease between cover and point
full outside off stump and what am I seeing? Tiripano brings out the reverse sweep and hits that fine to the left of short third man. Races away
Superb ball, pitches full outside off stump and straightens oh-so-minutely. The batsman's playing down the wrong line and the ball is millimeters away from his outside edge. Close
full on off stump, paddle sweeped away to fine leg
full on middle stump, defended back
full outside off stump and bunted back to mid off. Tiripano is not shy of playing some strokes
good length outside leg stump, spins away from the right hander and the keeper collects it far wide on the leg side
full on leg stump, worked away to the leg side to the sweeper fielder. No feet movement, though
short and quick onto the batsman, he punches it off top of middle stump and sends it back to long off
fuller outside off stump, Tiripano defends that like a top order batsman
full on off stump, glanced to the leg side in front of square and long off has to run square to retrieve that
short on middle stump, slight adjustment from the batsman as he moves back and then clips it to fine leg
full on middle stump and another reverse sweep from Ervine. This one was connected beautifully from leg stump and bisects the two fielders behind square on the off side
good length outside off stump, punched to long off of the back foot. And that's 300 for Zimbabwe.
the tail-ender attempts the reverse sweep this time. Looks very out of sorts, misses the ball that was pitched very wide of off stump
full on middle and off, defended off the front foot
another sweep. Gets low and paddles it fine, for a run to fine leg. When there is that much flight, that's a high-percentage stroke
flat on middle and leg, flicked away with hard hands through midwicket
nicely bowled. Flight, but not too loopy - in terms of trajectory. Ervine is forced to defend
more flight outside off, a thick outside edge to third man
intentionally tosses it wider and slower, enticing a drive, to which Ervine says no, thanks
flatter this time outside off, Ervine offers no stroke
full on leg stump, defended to mid on
full on leg stump once again, offers the straight bat to bunt it back to the bowler
full and outside off stump this time, driven straight to short cover
full and slower in the air this time, pitches on middle, a bat-pad defence
full outside off stump, he steps back and defends it with a vertical face
full outside off stump, brings his foot in front and defends that with ease. A maiden over
full outside off stump, the ball gripped after pitching and moved away from the left hander, he shoulders his arms
full and wide outside off stump, the batsman was tempted for a slog but he let it go past him.
good length and wide, cut away furiously but goes straight to the point fielder
full toss and bunted from outside off stump to long on. Gunaratne has been very indisciplined
full outside off stump, mistimes the straight defense. The ball finds its way to short leg
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler. Smart cricket from Tiripano. Resisting temptation
in the air!, but pad first. full on leg stump and the ball plops up after hitting the batsman's pads.
Shape right away, late swing into the left-handed batsman. Full outside off stump but finishes on middle, he defends it off the front foot
full and wide outside off stump, no inswing this time and therefore has enough width for the set Ervine to free his arms. Uppish drive that no fielder on the off side has any chance to save
good length pitching on middle, whips it off his pads from leg stump into the leg side
full outside off stump, gets his body behind the ball and offers the bat's full face
full on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler. Tiripano can bat!
full on middle stump, strongly driven to a wide-ish mid on
full outside off stump, played off the back foot on the leg side
full on off stump and hey, a reverse sweep once again. Crosses his legs like a scissor, and paddles it to the square on a right-hander's leg side
full on middle, worked to the leg side for a single
full outside off stump, looks to defend it but that is mistimed, goes to short leg
good length outside off stump and no spin this time, goes straight through to the keeper. Harmless
full on middle stump and it is Tiripano's time to reverse sweep! Gets to the pitch of the ball and plays it fine past the original short third man fielder
good length ball, punched off the back foot from outside off stump. Runs way to mid off
full outside off stump, Ervine shoulders his arms
good length ball outside off stump, angling away from the left hander. Enough room to free his arms but chooses against it
good length that finds the batsman's back-foot defence from top of middle stump, the ball flies away to point

good length outside off stump, punched off the back foot and it goes pat three four infielders on the off side. That one flew threw between cover and point. Nobody in the deep there in front of square
good length ball angling into the batsman's pads, he clips it from middle stump to the leg side
full on middle stump, back-foot defence straight back to the bowler
faster ball that's drifting down leg side, he helps the ball towards fine leg and gets off strike
good length, faster ball outside off stump, he paddles it towards the square leg umpire's direction
short and on leg stump, Tiripano rocks back and pulls it with ease. Races away before you could count to four
full on leg stump, played back straight to the bowler
full and wide outside off, played with soft hands towards point

this time he misses the reverse sweep and the Sri Lankans are going to scream their lungs out for an lbw. Umpire Gould says its not out but Chandimal isn't taking any chances. They're reviewing. . The ball pitched on off stump and the extra bounce makes Ervine miss that sweep. Replays suggest that was glove-first and not pad. Ervine will survive. A review wasted.
full on off stump, played to the leg side off his pads
good length outside off stump, back-foot jab towards point
this time the reverse sweep connects, but only finds the point fielder, full on off stump and no spin
flatter delivery pitching on middle, clips it off his pads in front of square on the leg side. The sweeper fielder has to run to his right and mop it up
good length outside off stump, punched back to long off and Ervine ensures he is going to keep strike
full outside leg stump, played with ease on the leg side but finds the midwicket fielder
full and wide, looks to cut it away but the ball stays low. Bottom edge that runs away to first slip
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler. No spin on offer at the moment

reverse sweep again, why am I not surprised? Full on middle, plays that shot once again to the fielder at the deep. Pitched full on off stump and Ervine exposes his stumps before sweeping that in the opposite direction
full on middle and leg and Tiripano finds the bat's inside edge. Files to short leg
pushes the batsman back this time, faster ball on middle stump and that smashes Tiripano's pads. Herath appeals but not out. That would've missed leg stump by atleast a few inches.
good length outside off stump, cut away fine to short third man
full on leg stump, clipped to the gap in front of the square leg umpire
full on off stump and Tiripano has ages to reverse sweep that. But there's protection in the deep for that shot now. Only a single this time
full on off stump, firmly defended back
short outside off stump and cut square emphatically. And now that's Ervine's highest-ever Test score!
good length on leg stump, hits his pads while he attempts the back-food defense. But impact is way outside leg
full outside off stump, pushed in front
full on off stump, defended towards the leg side
full on off stump, defended back again
full on middle stump, defended
full on off stump and glanced to the leg side for a single. Easy pickings as the light begins to get darker
good length on off stump, punched back to cover
full on middle and leg, looks to defend it but the inside edge takes the ball towards the gap on the leg side
good length outside off stump, punched to cover and he misfields. But no ones taking any chances off the misfield
good length outside off, cuts it fine to third man
Ervine gives it a charge and yorks the good-length ball himself. All he manages is to squeeze it back to Dilruwan
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
full outside leg stump, whips it to wide short fine leg, Lakmal misfields once again and Ervine can run through. That's 150!
full on middle stump, defended back straight to mid off
full outside off stump, played with soft hands on the off side and the batsmen scamper through for a single
good length on middle stump, back-foot defence straight back to the bowler
full on off stump, defended with soft hands. Ensures the ball rolls along the ground
frees his arms this time, looks to slog the ball over the mid off fielder. Goes down the ground behind the bowler

Tiripano was itching to smack the last few balls. Short on middle stump and he rocks back to pull that ball emphatically over mid wicket for four. The second-best way to finish the day's play for a batting team.
fullish, angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, tucked to the left of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the pitch
length ball, a little bit of shape in towards off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
bouncer, Tiripano keeps his eye on it and ducks. Slants down the leg side, bounces over his bent back

ooh, good ball. Length ball, angling into middle and leg, aiming for the clip to the man at leg gully. Plays with a straight bat, and the ball hits the inner half and slides towards that fielder, on the bounce
floated up slow, pitching on middle and leg and turning down leg. Clipped gently into the on side
tossed up on off stump, swept to deep square leg

there's the reverse-sweep. He plays it so confidently, off the stumps. This one's pitching just outside off and turning in towards middle and leg, and he casually slaps it against the turn, to deep point
flighted ball wide of off, and backward point is a little deep. Stretches out and pushes gently into that region
quickish length ball outside off, goes back and across to defend
back of a length outside off, punched with a straight bat to long-on

length ball, angling in sharply from around the wicket. Misses the flick and provokes a big lbw appeal, but it's clearly missing leg stump. Ball-tracking says umpire's call on leg stump - I don't trust it. Looked like it was going a long way down
looks for the yorker, spears it down the leg side
bouncer, easily ducked
full, close to off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come on and punches to deep point
looks for the yorker, ends up bowling it well down the leg side
there's that reverse-sweep again. This time the line is a fair way outside off and he can play it fine, a long way to the right of deep backward point
and again. This one's on off stump, swept to the fielder at deep backward point
bacj of a length outside off, makes a bit of room and forces it away to the right of cover point

that's excellent footballing skills from Tiripano. May have saved himself from getting bowled. Or almost ended up hit wicket. Full, speared in towards off stump. Blocks into the ground, bounces up just outside off, and he turns around and kicks it away

gone, Herath has a five-for! The reverse-sweep was a productive shot for Tiripano yesterday, but it's a risky shot with slip in place. Ball pitches outside off, dipping a little shorter than Tiripano would like, and he ends up gloving it to the fielder at slip
fullish on off stump, presses forward and blocks. Rolls off the inner half into the on side
yorker on off stump, blocked to long-on. Doesn't take the single
short outside off, punched to deep point. No single again
short outside off, once more. Lets it come on and dabs to third man. No run again

bangs it in short, and he's got his man! Slanted across the left-hander, steep bounce. Looks to stay next to the line and carve it over fine third man. Doesn't hit it as fine as he'd like, and Dilruwan, running to his right at third man, takes a good, tumbling catch
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, close to off stump, blocked into the covers
a bit of shape in. Pitches in the corridor, on a good length, and straightens slightly. Left alone
fullish on off stump, again some shape back in. Defended into the on side. He's getting really close to the stumps and Llong has another look at his follow-through
length ball on middle stump, clipped towards mid-on
fullish, slanting away from off stump. Driven to the right of mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended towards mid-off
full on middle stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length, swinging down leg, tucked away to the left of long leg
back of a length, close to off stump. Not enough room to punch through cover, may have stopped on him too. Pushed towards mid-off off the inner half of the bat
wide, overpitched ball, and Tharanga gets down low and drives sweetly through cover point
length ball, pitching on off and middle and slanting away. Left alone
length ball swinging in slightly towards off stump, defended from the crease, back towards the bowler
ooh. Full inswinger, homing in on off and middle. Gets his pad out of the way in a hurry and jams down a straight bat to jab towards midwicket

ooh, good ball. He's been swinging a few, and he's planted some doubt in Tharanga's mind. Back of a length in the corridor, and this one doesn't swing back. Pokes at it, away from his body, but didn't go too hard at it. Ball rolls away off the outside edge, falling to the right of second slip
don't bowl full and wide to him. He drove one through cover point in the previous over. This one's closer to the man at short extra-cover, but he can't stop it despite a desperate dive to his right
length ball on off and middle, stays back, lets it come on, and drops it gently to midwicket's left
length ball swinging in towards off stump, blocked to mid-off
fullish outside off, driven firmly and mid-off does well to stop it with a dive to his left. Cremer the fielder
short outside off, and Tharanga puts it away easily. Good step back and across, in a great position to punch it away to the left of backward point
full on off stump, overpitched, driven back down the pitch, between the stumps and the non-striker. No way mid-off can get anywhere near it
length ball on middle stump, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on middle stump, defended towards short extra-cover
back of a length, down leg, tucked away to the right of long leg
nice length outside off, and he gets it to bounce a touch more than expected. Stops on the pitch too. Drives too early, and the ball pops up in the air, but falls well short of mid-off
length ball outside off, and Tharanga leans into the shot of the morning. Just shows it the full face, transfers his weight forward, and finds the gap to the right of mid-off
length ball wide of off, slapped firmly to backward point
shortish outside off, chops it hard into the ground and backward point stops it with arms outstretched over his head
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked away to long leg
shortish outside off, slapped to backward point
back of a length, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick off the hip
slower length ball wide of off, adjusts to let it come on and plays a checked drive to cover point
bouncer angling down leg, Chakabva moves quickly to his right and reaches it with a leap and an outstretched right glove
fullish, close to off stump, gets forward to defend, and the ball straightens slightly and rolls towards second slip off the outer half of the bat
back of a length on leg stump, punched to midwicket
full on middle stump, defended to midwicket
down the track and he's not quite to the pitch of this one, drifting in from outside off. Stretches out and blocks towards short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off
tossed up slow outside off, driven to long-off
flighted ball on middle and leg. Gets his front pad out of the way to drive back to the bowler
short, wide, punched to the left of deep point
fullish outside off, driven to cover
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
fullish on off stump, punched back firmly and Tiripano stops it with his left foot

shortish outside off, leans back to cut and there's some extra bounce, may have stopped on the pitch too. Hits the shoulder of the bat and bounces down in front of the tumbling keeper, who can't collect cleanly
bouncer, easily ducked
fullish on off stump, clipped to mid-on
flat, back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease for the push to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
flighted ball on off stump, driven back to the bowler
nice length, a bit of drift in, pitching just outside off, and then turns away. Defended into the covers
good length again, defended to short extra-cover
fullish, angling into off stump from wide of the crease. Defended to midwicket
ooh, good ball. Nips away off the seam after angling into off stump. Opened up in defence, and the ball rolls to backward point off the outside edge
back of a length close to off stump, defended to mid-off
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, clipped to midwicket
long-hop, sits up at waist height on off stump and Karunaratne pulls it away to the left of midwicket
tossed up on off stump, defended into the covers
nice flight close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
a bit fuller, on off stump, driven to mid-off. Good to see that the fielder's been brought in
a bit of drift in towards middle stump, then it straightens. Playing slightly outside the line, thanks to the drift, he inside-edges his defensive prod into the on side
another flighted ball, now he simply jumps out and launches him high, back over his head
length ball on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
length ball outside off, left alone. Angled it in from wide of the crease and got some extra bounce, but not close enough to off stump to make the batsman play
back of a length on off stump, steps across and works it to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended to extra-cover
full outside off, looks to drive through the covers, but the inward angle from around the wicket cramps him a bit, ends up playing it to mid-off instead
length ball outside off, defended to extra-cover
bowled on a line just outside off without much turn from around the wicket, the batsman stays back and cuts to point
Tharanga goes back again and opens the face a bit more this time, trying to get the ball behind point, but the fielder moves quickly to his right and cuts it off
defended on the front foot
goes back and waits for the ball to come into him with the angle before nudging it off his pads on the leg side
Karunaratne presses forward and blocks with a straight bat
a fuller ball on middle stump, driven firmly and straight, the bowler falls to his left and cuts off the shot
a length ball wide outside off, the batsman opens the face and steers the ball through point
more width outside off at a gentle pace, Karunaratne stays back and moves towards the ball before driving through point
a slower ball angling into the right hander, defended on the off side
Tharanga uses the width on offer to lean into a graceful cover drive
defended from the crease back to the bowler
pitches on a length outside off and angles into the left-hander, he stays back and pushes the ball into the covers
punched off the front foot into the covers where the fielder intercepts with a little juggling act
steps out and plays the ball back to the bowler

an attempted paddle sweep but he does not make contact, the Zimbabweans appeal for lbw but it looks like the impact on the pad was outside off stump. The umpire says not out but Zimbabwe review! I'm pretty sure that hit the pad outside off stump. Replays confirm, and the visitors lose a review. That ball was missing off stump as well.
Tharanga responds to the review with a charge and drive to mid-on, he didn't time it as well as he wanted because he couldn't get to the pitch of the ball
pushed off the front foot on the off side
goes back and taps the ball from outside off into the leg side
first ball is a long hop, bowled flat and straight, the batsman pulls to the fielder at deep square leg
steps out to a fuller ball and clips it off his pads towards deep midwicket
drifts across the left-hander and spins back, defended on the front foot
Tharanga jabs forward in defence and gets an inside edge that sends the ball in the air but out of the reach of the man at short leg
steps out and drives the ball along the ground to long on

another paddle sweep and another appeal for lbw, but that was outside the line of off stump as well. In line, but ball-tracking shows it's going over the stumps. Ball rolls away off the thigh into the short fine leg region
short outside off. Rocks back, opens up at the hips, and pulls to the right of deep midwicket.
fuller now, clipped into the leg side
short outside off, slapped to backward point
short again, gets really deep in his crease to pull, this time he beats long-on running to his left
flat length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up on off stump, looks to whip to mid-on but the bowler gets in the way, tumbling to his left

back of a length, turning into the pads, and he tucks it away to deep square leg to bring up a breezy half-century. He's looking in superb touch, there's very little in the pitch or the bowling to trouble him - he must be setting his sights really high now
down the track, flattens his trajectory and he blocks back to the bowler
down the track again, slows it down and bowls it a little wider, pulling his length back. Stretches out to defend back to the bowler
tossed up, drifting across the left-hander. Driven into the covers
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
goes back to a length ball on off stump, clips to short leg
down the track, meets this flighted, inward-drifting ball on the full and punches to mid-on
short, wide, slapped away to deep point
not as short this time, makes a bit of room to dab to backward point
nice length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

oh, beauty. This one's slightly wider outside off, tossed up slightly slower than the previous one and dropping slightly shorter. Presses forward and reaches out with his hands to adjust, but it rips away and beats his outside edge
flat and short on off and middle, pulled to the right of deep backward square leg
nice flight, dips onto a good length outside off and turns back sharply. Presses forward to defend, gets his front pad in the way, but impact is outside off
and again, his pad goes across and comes in the way of his defensive shot. This one's a little flatter and quicker, strikes outside the line of off stump
dips it onto that spot again. Comes forward to defend, rolls back to the bowler off inside edge
floated up slower and wider, driven through cover point
down the track to the flighted, dipping ball on off and middle. Lets it dip and flicks it through forward square leg
back of a length, punched to cover
short, a bit wider. Doesn't come on and he slaps it to cover, off the inside half of the bat
flat, back of a length outside off, leans back and punches to cover
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
a bit closer to off, blocked to short extra
short, a bit of width, jabbed to cover point
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and punches to deep point
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, doesn't reach the pitch, stretches out to block to short extra-cover
down the track again. The line is straighter this time and Karunaratne clips to mid-on
oh my. That's a 107kph bouncer. Sudden change of pace, and he ducks hurriedly. Well done by Chakabva to get his glove up over his head to parry it
down the track again and he doesn't reach the pitch. Spins past his flick and hits pad
shortish, slanting across towards off stump, opens his bat face to steer it to the right of deep point
flat and full on off stump, driven to short extra
fullish on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
fired in full on middle and off. Mid-off is too deep to save the single, and Tharanga pushes straight to him and runs
flat, round-arm, length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit of flight, full on off stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
flat length ball close to off stump, blocked into the off side
back of a length, turning into leg stump, goes deep in his crease to work it to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
long-hop, and that's easily put away, transfers his weight quickly through his hips to pull that through straight midwicket
ooh, that's a risky leave. Good response from Cremer, dangles this one up outside off, gets it to dip and rip back in. Doesn't miss off stump by too much
tossed up outside off, clipped to long-on
short on middle stump, pulled to deep backward square leg
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone

and that's a sensational catch at slip! Shortish, perhaps not enough width to cut. Slashes hard, gets a thick edge, and Masakadza barely has time to react, grabs it two-handed over his head while falling backwards
length ball on middle and off, clipped through square leg
oh, nearly! If the gully was a little finer... Short outside off, and he slashes without any feet. Slices it away to the right of the diving gully fielder
length ball wide of off, left alone
length ball outside off, driven to deepish cover, who's stationed in between, and behind, the fielders at short cover point and short extra-cover
quickish length ball on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
nice flight, a bit of drift in towards middle stump. Defended to mid-off
lovely. Some drift again, a bit of turn as well. Defended to short extra-cover. This one dipped onto a better length than that previous ball
fuller, driven to the left of mid-off
tossed up, floated across the left-hander. Stretches across and eases it to deep point with an open face

short, and that's nearly another cheap dismissal for Kusal against Zimbabwe! Rocks back to pull, and Raza, diving forward and to his right at midwicket, can't quite reach the ball on the full. Bounced just short of him, he indicates. Just a bit of extra bounce
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
length ball wide of off, slices a drive out to deep point
full, angling into off stump. Wants to drive to mid-on, hits the inner half of the bat and rolls to the fielder's right
length ball wide of off, left alone
length ball, fifth-stump line, steered with an open face down to deep backward point
length ball on off stump and that's nicely flicked. Would probably have gone for four had Raza not dived to his left from midwicket and got a hand to it
length ball just outside off, defended to short extra-cover
big appeal for lbw, doesn't get down low enough quickly enough to sweep. Pitches shorter than he'd like and spins to hit his pad. Pitched outside leg though
short, and this time Kusal puts away the pull. Gets back in a flash, feet wide apart and hips open, and pulls through square leg
tossed up on off stump, achieves some dip. Goes hard at the drive, ends up slicing it to the right of backward point. Wanted to hit that through cover. Hard hands from Mendis
full outside off, jabbed to short extra-cover
length ball turning sharply down leg, beats Tharanga's flick, and easily beats Chakabva as well

bouncer, rising steeply over off stump. Looks to hook from over his right shoulder. Ball stops slightly, and he meets it well in front of his body. Manages to get on top of the bounce and drag it around to long leg
length ball, slower ball, angling into the corridor outside off, defended to short extra-cover
wide length ball, slapped to short cover point

length ball wide of off, seams away slightly, and is that a drop? Nah. Fielder at gully, Ervine, dives  to his left, and it bounces just short of him and then hits him in the groin region. Looks to be in some pain here
length ball wide of off, and this time Tharanga leaves it
fuller, just as wide, Tharanga leaves again
full-toss on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket
once again, Tharanga stretches forward and across to defend a dipping legbreak, and his front pad gets in the way as it dips and turns. Impact well outside off, though
fuller, eases a checked drive into the covers

Zimbabwe are roaring back to life here, that's a super delivery. Flight, dip, and sharp turn outside off. Reaches out, away from his body, in defence, and the ball clips the shoulder of the bat and Chakabva takes an excellent catch, over his right shoulder

Greets him with a googly. Not sure he picked it, but it was short enough for him to adjust and read it off the pitch, and started straight enough for him to clip it off his pads to the fine leg boundary
ooh, Cremer's really ripping them now. Again he gets it to dip and turn quickly, and he beats a drive away from the body
wide length ball, left alone
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, and that's a lovely shot. Presses onto the front foot, waits for the ball to come on, and opens his bat face to steer it wide of gully
back to that sixth-stump line, Tharanga leaves it
shortish, just a bit of width, slapped away to deep point
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, a little closer to off stump. Nice, stylish stride forward to block into the covers
dips onto a good length outside off, defended into the covers
flighted ball wide of off, driven to the right of mid-off
full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
quickish length ball turning into middle and off, defended down in front of short leg
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease and defends with soft hands to short leg
