again, he gets it to dip on Tharanga. Floats it across the left-hander, gets a bit of drift away too, but it drops shorter than he expects as he stretches across to defend, and beats his inside edge to hit front pad. Once again, he gets that pad outside the line of off stump

in the blockhole on off stump, and is that a run-out at the non-strikers' end? Driven back firmly, Tiripano bends low in his follow-through and indicates he got a fingertip to the ball on its way to the stumps. They're checking with the third umpire... A definite deflection, and that's horrible backing up. Tharanga has his bat in his right hand while standing on the right of the stumps, and as a result he's trying to get back with his foot rather than stretching out his bat. Doesn't get there in time, and he'll have to go. A breezy, entertaining innings ended by a casual moment at the non-strikers' end
back of a length on leg stump, clipped through backward square leg

wow. That's a beaut. What a first ball to get. A dipping, yorker-length slower ball. Has no idea where that's going, and he just about jams his bat down in front of his pad. If he'd missed, that would have struck him in line with middle and leg, maybe middle, and he was back in his crease. Rolls away off the inside edge to long leg
full on off stump, driven towards mid-on
drifts onto the pads, clips to long leg
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to defend to midwicket
nicely flighted outside off, stretches out and steers with an open face to backward point
ooh, flight and dip, defended into the point region. Hit the high part of the outer half of the bat. Really didn't pitch as full as Chandimal expected
again, beats Chandimal in the air slightly with some flight outside off, jabbed out to cover point, away from the body
now a full-toss on off stump and he nearly gets himself out to it. Plays an airy sweep, and he's fortunate that bounces short of the man at deep backward square leg
short outside off, punched away to deep point
flat, angled down leg and then it turns back towards Chandimal's pads. Worked to the right of short leg
short outside off, slapped to deep point
flighted ball on middle stump, defended to short leg
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-off
nice flight on off stump, gets forward to defend but he isn't quite to the pitch. Lets it come and opens his bat face to squeeze it out towards point
down the track, meets this on the full and drives back to the bowler
flighted ball outside off, Mathews drives to short extra-cover, playing away from his body
nice length outside off, lots of turn and bounce. Left alone
a bit more flight, full on middle and leg, clipped through backward square leg
a bit of dip outside off, tossed that nice and high. Pushes away from his body for the checked drive to deepish mid-off
back of a length, close to off stump. Punched nicely and short cover moves quickly to his left to intecept
nice line, pitching just outside leg on a good length. Makes sure he doesn't close his bat face, defends to mid-off with the full face showing
this one's flighted on the same line, but it's overpitched, and Chandimal whips it away easily, wide of mid-on. Full-toss, in fact.
tossed up outside off, blocked to mid-off
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to short extra
a bit slower, just as full, gives Mathews a little more time to assess his options. Presses forward and opens his bat face slightly to push to the left of short extra-cover
fired in round-arm, full on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, driven inside-out to the right of sweeper cover
length ball on off and middle, defended to mid-on

fullish, and is that a bit of reverse in towards middle and leg? Maybe a little bit, but nothing to perturb Mathews, who leans forward and flicks stylishly to beat midwicket diving left and mid-on, sprinting and diving right. Super shot
back of a length on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
full, a bit of reverse again but starts too straight. Clipped off the toes through square leg
full on off stump, shows the full face to punch to mid-on
back of a length outside off, left alone
tossed up on off stump, and short extra-cover dives left to stop that checked drive
flat length ball outside off, squeezed away to the left of backward point
flat, round-arm ball on middle stump, defended back to the right of the bowler
once again, flat on middle stump. Gets his front pad out of the way to block it back to the bowler
slower now, tossed up on off stump. Plays slightly away from his body at that, checks his drive, and the ball is in the air for a bit but doesn't carry to short extra
flatter, angling into middle and leg, defended to short leg
fullish, a bit of reverse towards middle stump, clipped to the straighter of the two short midwickets
full on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball, a bit of late swing in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
full outside off, and what a shot that is. Nice stride forward, head over the ball, perfectly straight bat and high left elbow, and that runs away between mid-off and short extra-cover. Beautiful
full, drifts onto the pads, clipped to long leg
fires one down the leg side. Can't connect with the flick, rolls off the pad to the left of the keeper
flighted and full on off stump, driven firmly to short extra-cover
full on middle stump, looks for the inside-out drive to long-off, but the bowler moves quickly to his left to stop it
flat and short on off stump, punched to long-off
fired in flat on leg stump, defended to midwicket
ooh, good ball. Flat and quick length ball angling into off stump, no turn. Goes back to punch to short extra
bouncer over middle stump, Chandimal ducks under it
bouncer over off stump, Chandimal ducks again
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
in the blockhole on middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way and clips to the squarer of the two short midwickets
full on off stump, shows the full face and pushes to mid-on, who's deep enough to allow an easy single
fullish on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
shortish on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
fired in full and round-arm on off stump, presses forward to drive to long-off
full on middle stump, blocked to midwicket. Nigel Llong indicates Williams has overstepped
tossed up on off stump, drops onto a good length, Mathews blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover
length ball outside off, plays a bottom-handed jab out to short extra-cover
bouncer over off stump, gets into a semi-crouch to evade it
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to defend to short extra-cover
bouncer outside off, left alone. Bounces high enough for Ian Gould to deem it a wide
full outside off, nice stride forward to drive to cover with a high left elbow
back of a length outside off, punched to point
fired in flat, round-arm, on a good length angling into middle and off, defended into the on side
again a good length, on off stump, defended into the covers
fuller now, outside off, driven to cover point. Whoops, he's overstepped again
flighted ball close to off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball angling in towards off stump, presses forward to block into the covers
length ball outside off, defended to short extra-cover

flat, fullish, a little wide of off. Jabbed to cover point and there's a brief misunderstanding here. Matthews took a couple of steps out, stopped, and sent back Chandimal, who had responded at the other end. Throw, however, came to the keeper's end, so no real trouble. May have been interesting had he thrown to Chandimal's end, because he had really sprinted out
short and wide, slapped past the diving man at short cover, and sweeper cover, running right, tries to stop it with his boot instead of diving, ends up kicking it into the rope
flighted and full on leg stump, jabbed inside-out and short extra-cover dives right to stop it
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper cover
nice flight, a bit of drift in towards middle and leg, defended into the covers, gets his front pad out of the way
ooh, dip and turn outside off. Not quite short enough for the cut, a bit of extra bounce, and he hits it uppishly towards backward point
back of a length, flat, on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
full on middle and off, defended to short extra-cover
nice flight on off stump, comes forward early, waits, and opens his bat face to account for the turn and stab towards point
floated up slow on off stump, driven to the right of the diving cover fielder, down to long-off
flat and fullish outside off, nice use of the hands to reach out and lap-sweep to deep backward square leg

fired in flat on off stump, and Chandimal is a little late going on the back foot. Stopped and bounced, and Chandimal, jabbing hard at it, gets a thick outside edge that flies past the diving fielder at slip
flat and round-arm, angling into off stump, defended into the covers
nice flight and drift in towards off stump. Doesn't quite get to the pitch in defence and it spins away and rolls off the outside edge, wide of slip

down the leg side this time, and that's not the best bit of fielding at the long leg boundary. Tiripano ran right from deep backward square leg to stop the sweep, tumbles to his right, but lets the ball slip through his fingers
length ball outside off, leans forward and jabs into the covers, more hands than feet in that defensive push
nice length on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
drifts in towards the pads, quite full, clipped to short leg
tossed up on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
flat length ball straightening towards off stump. Lets it come on and defends with soft hands into the point region
length ball outside off. Trusts that it won't turn too much and plays a little dab-sweep out to long leg
flat and quick length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
shortish outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length close to off stump, goes deep in his crease to block to silly point
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
floated up slow on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length, straightens towards off stump, punched back to the bowler's right, and he makes the diving stop
tossed up full on off stump, clipped to long-on
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
down the track and he flights it wider. Whips it wristily, back to the bowler. Wanted to play that to long-on for one
nice drift in towards off stump, some turn away. Gets his head low, right over the ball, to defend into the point region. Cremer's overstepped
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper cover
ooh, well bowled. Tossed it up high and got some dip. Wanted to clip towards long-on, I think, and he ended up playing it back to the bowler, since he didn't quite meet it at the pitch of the ball
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
googly, pitching outside off, short enough for the batsman to adjust and block it back to the bowler
sharp turn from middle stump. Stays on the back foot to defend towards point

ooh, lovely. Similar ball to the one that nicked off Kusal Mendis. Chandimal, however, plays close to his body, doesn't follow it, and is happy to have his outside edge beaten. To be fair, he did push at it, but was looking to play down the ground so his hands didn't follow it wide of off stump
length ball on off and middle, defended into the on side
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
short outside off, slapped to the right of backward point

oh my. Casual shot from Mathews, leaned forward and across for that lap-sweep he's been playing from outside off. Doesn't turn, and the ball misses his bat, clips his pad outside off, and beats the keeper, who's moving to his left to try and intercept a top-edged sweep
length ball turning down leg. Clips the pad and rolls down to fine leg
flat length ball on off stump, goes back and across to clip to midwicket
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
again a short legbreak, stabbed away through point
back of a length, slides on towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to clip through square leg
short again, this time it isn't as wide and he cuts to backward point
tossed up slow on off and middle, driven to long-off
short and wide, extends his arms to slap to the right of sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward for a push to mid-off, who's deep enough to allow an easy single
flatter length ball angling across to off stump, defended back down the pitch
nice, a bit of drift away and not as much turn in as Mathews expects while coming forward to defend. Off the outside half of the bat to short extra-cover
excellent. Knows the field like the back of his hand. Tossed up a little wider outside off and his hands work super quick to reverse-slap it to the left of backward point
down the track now, shortens his length slightly. Tucked away quietly to the right of midwicket
flat, back of a length, on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning towards off stump, punched to short extra-cover
tossed up full on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up full on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
shortish outside off, stabbed away to sweeper cover
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover
stays back to a length ball on middle stump, defends back to the bowler
good length, turning back from off stump to off stump. Goes on the back foot and squeezes a defensive jab out towards square leg
tossed up slow on leg stump, stretches out and lap-sweeps nice and fine
goes back to a length ball on middle stump, punches to midwicket

shortish, slanting across to off stump without much turn, pulled away to deep forward square leg to bring up an excellent fifty. Came in with his side under pressure, and he's just batted calmly and sensibly since then
down the track to the flighted leg-stump ball, clips to long-on
down the track and he floats this slower and wider. Stretches out to push to mid-off
tossed up slow on off stump, gets forward for a checked push into the covers
dips onto a better length this time, on middle and leg. Defended inside-out to short extra-cover
full now, on off stump. Wants to drive to long-off but short extra moves right to intercept
ooh, nicely bowled. Floated this up slower and wider, and it dipped, and Mathews, reaching out away from his body to drive, slices it away, uppishly, through point
flatter now, length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
lovely length, dipping onto off stump and turning away. Chandimal gets a big stride forward and head over the ball to defend to short extra-cover
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, whips it to midwicket
length ball on off stump. Takes a big step back and across to try and shorten the length slightly to work it square of midwicket. Can't manage it, hits it straight to the fielder

whoops, not the greatest execution. Donald Tiripano got out somewhat like this today. Tries the reverse-sweep, ends up gloving it over the man at slip. Not quite the length for the shot, dipped on him a little
fullish on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
on the pads now, clipped to square leg
tossed up nicely, slants it across the right-hander's stumps. Stretches out to defend, turns in and hits the inside half of the bat to roll into the leg side
shortish outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
oh, that's some serious turn. Quick turn too. Drifts in towards middle stump, comes forward to defend, and it rips right across his bat face

oh man. looks to sweep from middle stump, dips slightly on him and he top-edges it high. Mpofu, running left from deep backward square leg, dives forward, but misjudges it slightly and it falls an inch short of his hands
full on off stump, defended to short extra
sharp turn again, outside off. Wants to defend into the covers and it hits the shoulder of his bat and rolls to backward point
tossed up on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
shortish, a bit of width, rocks back and punches between cover point and extra-cover
length ball on off stump, slow, goes back and punches back to the bowler
back of a length, turning in towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to clip through square leg
slow length ball on middle and off, goes back and across to clip to deep square leg
tossed up full outside off, defended to short extra-cover
flighted onto the pads, clipped away to long leg
short and wide, slapped to cover, who's set slightly deep. There's a short extra-cover too
tossed up now, turns sharply from outside off. Left alone

lovely, lovely delivery, and that's another superb catch by Chakabva. Gets a bit of drift in towards middle and off, gets it to dip as well, and Chandimal is nowhere near the pitch in defence. Ripping turn and bounce, hit the shoulder of the bat, and Chakabva rides the bounce and makes it look so easy
nicely pitched legbreak on off stump, defended into the on side.
ooh, hung this out a little wider and slower. Looks to drive away from his body, against the turn, and inside-edges into his front pad
nice flight again, a little closer to off stump. Stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
full outside off, clipped to the left of midwicket

yikes. Another streaky reverse-sweep from Mathews. The shot was on, it was pitched nice and wide of off, but he didn't get his head over the ball, allowed it to turn back in, and he gloves it in the air, but to the left of backward point
full-toss outside off, swiped down to long-on
down the track and Raza fires it quicker, on off stump. Blocked back to the bowler
nicely played. Length ball pitching outside off and turning further away. Jabs it away to sweeper cover, playing a little bit away from his body but using his hands nicely
length ball on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
down the track to the flighted off-stump ball, drives whippily to the left of mid-off
sharp turn from outside off, beats the bat. Unwise to try and sweep him from there when he's spinning it so much
tossed up fuller, driven to long-off
tossed up wide of off stump, gets down low for the flat-bat drive through cover point, against the turn
back of a length, turning back in towards off stump. Leans back and chops it down, and slip dives left to stop it

ooh, dipping legbreak pitching on middle stump. Comes on the front foot to flick, and he hits it in the air, off the inside half of the bat, to the left of short leg. Risky shot on a turning pitch, the front-foot flick
Mathews continues to reverse-sweep. Length ball on leg stump, he goes against the turn and slaps it to backward point
slanted fuller, outside off, blocked back to the bowler
now the lap-sweep. Stretches out, meets it low and on the full outside off, and lets it run off his bat face to fine leg
ooh, that's not very well played. Goes back onto leg stump to a length ball pitching on middle and turning towards off. Stays leg side of the ball and jabs defensively into the covers
makes a bit of room again. This one's a back-of-a-length ball on off stump, dabs it away neatly to the left of slip
down the track, doesn't reach the pitch of this offbreak that's bowled slower. Dips on him and he jabs away from his body to account for the turn, plays into the covers
shortish outside off, stops on Mathews a little. Wanted to cut it, ends up flat-batting to short extra-cover
tossed up full on middle stump, defended to short extra-cover
flighted ball pitching just outside leg. Full enough to clip against the turn, to the right of midwicket

bowled him! Not the greatest shot from Dickwella. He's been a little loose right through this innings. Not short enough to cut, and it doesn't even pitch that far outside off. Just stays leg-side of the ball and stabs at it with an angled bat. Turns back in and cannons into the stumps off the inside edge and back pad
googly first up. Spins past the inside edge as he jabs uncertainly at it, and pops up to short leg off pad. Spinning down leg, so not much of an appeal. Decent bounce too, it hit thigh pad
full on leg stump, defended to mid-on
tossed up on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
flighted slower and wider outside off. Mathews misses the reverse-sweep
full on middle and leg, clipped back to the bowler
fullish outside off, good stretch out to defend back down the pitch
flat, back of a length, continuing on with the angle away from off stump. Punched to midwicket
tossed up full outside off, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
flighted again, slower, on off stump, stretches out to defend to short extra-cover
flat legbreak pitching on leg and turning towards off. Goes deep in his crease to punch to the right of mid-on
excellent. Drifts in towards middle and off and rips away square. Mathews leaves it well
googly. Dipping and turning past the inside edge of his defensive shot. Lobs off the pad into the fine leg region
length ball on off stump, defended quietly into the off side
back of a length on off stump, and that's nicely played. Goes deep in his crease, lets it come on, and dabs it away to the left of backward point
down the track, dips on off stump and he defends watchfully towards short extra-cover
tossed up outside off, left alone
down the track and he shortns his length. Punches with a straight bat to square midwicket
bam. Floats it up wide of off stump and he uses that room to slog-sweep hard over midwicket
sharp turn here. Presses forward to defend in front of off stump. Dips, turns,bounces, hits high on the inside edge and he's lucky that drops downwards instead of popping up to short leg
short outside off, slapped to backward point
length ball on the pads, clipped quietly into the leg side
full on leg stump and he reverse-sweeps to backward point. First time he's played that shot against the legspinner
flat now, drops slightly short, makes a bit of room and stabs to backward point
tossed up on middle and off, stretches out to defend towards short extra
tossed up outside off, reaches out to jab to short extra
full on off stump, driven to short extra
back of a length close to off stump, blocked into the covers
fired in full on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket

taken, that's brilliant from Masakadza! Looks for the lap-sweep from outside off, premeditates. The ball is a touch on the short side for that shot, and it loops up off the top half of the bat, behind the keeper, to his left. Masakadza turns around at slip, sprints some 15 yards, and then dives forward to take it two-handed
fired in flat at the pads. Not much of a forward stride to defend and it pops up in the air, wide of short leg
again, not much of a front-foot stride, Perera this time. Length ball pitching on middle stump and straightening. Looks to work it against the turn and pops a leading edge into the covers

another glorious legbreak from Cremer. Drifts in towards leg stump, dips, and rips past the outside edge. Big appeal for caught behind. Zimbabwe have referred this upstairs... I think he's missed it. Side-by-side side-on and front-on replays confirm that.

this one pitches outside leg and doesn't turn. Goes on the back foot, maybe looking for turn, and then hurriedly adjusts to flick, then decides to let it pass down the leg side. Ends up pulling his bat away a touch too late, and inside-edges it. Flies away to the left of the keeper
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full now, on off stump, presses forward to block into the covers
full outside off, squeezes a drive past the diving short extra-cover fielder, down to long-off. Then hobbles to the other end. He's clearly in some pain
slow length ball on off stump, goes deep in his crease, back and across, to block it back towards the bowler
flat length ball on leg stump, defended into the on side
fullish on middle and leg, blocked into the off side
flat, back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, stops on Gunaratne as he makes room to punch. Off the inside edge, back to the bowler
tossed up slightly slower on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fired in flat on leg stump. Doesn't get a stride forward and looks to defend into the leg side, bat coming down from the gully region. Ends up getting a leading edge that rolls into the covers
lovely length, pitches on middle and leg and turns towards off. Defended into the covers
floated up a bit fuller, blocked back to the bowler
googly, lots of extra bounce, leaping up towards the left hip. Looks to whip it away but can't connect. Hits high on the thigh pad
another googly, tossed up higher and fuller. Looks to drive through cover, inside-edges through backward square leg
flat length ball turning towards off stump. Plays from the crease in defence, lets it come on and dabs wide of slip
length ball on leg stump, defended towards midwicket

down the track to the flighted ball just outside off. Dilruwan is picking these moments of aggression well. Gets nice and close to the pitch and extends his arms through a flowing drive, high and sweet over the bowler's head
flatter now, fired in towards off stump. Is a little slow getting forward to defend, squeezes it away, wide of slip, off the outside edge
full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
shortish outside off, stabbed away to the left of sweeper cover
a bit of flight, angled in round-arm towards off and middle. Blocked back to the bowler
full outside off, drives inside-out, slices it along the ground to backward point
full on middle and off. Defended from the crease, runs off the inside edge to the right of short leg
tossed up nice and slow on off stump. Reaches out to drive, scoops it in the air, but safely. Rolls down to long-off
short, long hop, put away. Spots the length quickly, rocks right back and pulls it away through straight midwicket
tossed up much slower outside off. Does well in the end. Reached out to drive, initially, then held himself, and blocked into the point region
and another. Dilruwan getting some vital runs here. Drops short again, a short-arm pull from just outside off, wide of mid-on
dips onto a good length outside off. Stays on the back foot, waits, and defends with soft hands into the point region
fired in on middle and leg, jabbed back to the bowler

length ball sliding on towards middle and leg. Plays for the turn in defence, from the crease, and the inside-edge rolls down towards fine leg. Hobbles to the other end. He's really struggling with that hamstring
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, skips out and clips to mid-on
floated up on off stump, driven inside-out into the covers
flat, fired in towards off and middle, not much turn. Blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, turning from leg to middle, goes deep in his crease to push to mid-on
short outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
ooh, well played. Hurries on straight after pitching, towards middle stump. Goes deep in his crease and punches to midwicket
well bowled. Dangles this up slow, wide of off. Stretches out to defend, jabbing away from the body, outside edge rolls away wide of slip
googly, rips in and bounces as he stretches out to defend in front of middle and off. Hits high on the pad and pops up to short leg. No inside edge
the sharp legbreak to follow. Beats the outside edge of his defensive bat with turn and bounce, and for once Chakabva can't collect cleanly
length ball on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
down the track, meets this off-stump ball on the full and whips to long-on
tossed up on off stump, defended into the point region

down the track, and Dilruwan continues to pick up vital runs. Flat-bat swipe down the ground, met it outside off and hit it between the non-striker and the stumps. The man at mid-on does well to run back and stop it with a full-stretch dive
back of a length, sliding in towards leg stump, punched through midwicket
quick turn from off stump. Defended into the point region, off the outside half of the bat. Can't really stretch forward, given the state of his hamstrings
fuller, driven quietly to long-off
back of a length outside off, defended to short extra-cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off
short outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
tossed up full on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler

back of a length outside off, and he's gone! Superb fielding at backward point by the debutant Musakanda, sprinting quickly to his right, throwing himself across full-length to stop Gunaratne's back-foot punch. He picks it up and flicks it to the man at cover in one motion. The cover fielder, Waller, throws on the bounce to the keeper, and he has the bails off before Dilruwan can make it. Ironically, the hamstrung Gunaratne always wanted the single. Dilruwan hesitated, fatally. Amazing, amazing bit of work from Musakanda. One of the plays of the year. Or decade. Or ever.
bangs it in short, angling in from wide of the crease. Jumps back and across and defends into the off side with soft hands
length ball outside off, left alone
short, angling down leg, swivels to pull. Hits the thigh pad and rolls down to long leg
short on off stump, and Asela hammers it. Steps back and across and pulls firmly through backward square leg
shot. This one's short outside off, and he rolls his wrists over nicely to play a controlled pull to deep square leg. The fielder dropped back onto the rope after the first pull
googly, pitching short enough for Asela to adjust off the pitch. Makes a bit of room and punches into the covers
lovely legbreak outside off, stretches out and defends towards backward point
fuller now, pitching on middle and turning towards off. Blocked back down the pitch
flat slider on middle stump, defended into the on side
length ball pitching on off and turning away. Stays back to punch to short extra-cover
flighted ball down the leg side, clipped through backward square leg and Asela retains the strike
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler. A hint of outswing
fullish on middle stump, clipped away through square leg. Midwicket races after it
full, angling down leg. Misses the flick and Chakabva, diving left, lets it slip through for four byes. Dipped just as it approached his gloves, and sneaked under
ooh. Fullish on off stump. Wanted to drive down the ground, I think. Didn't really get forward, and ended up hitting it through square leg off the inside half of the bat
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
shortish outside off. Not enough width to cut, and he chops it into the ground, bounces up loopily towards backward point
tossed up on middle stump, clipped to short leg
there's the Herath sweep. Powerful swipe. A good length ball pitching outside off, and he slaps it powerfully to the right of short leg
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
big legbreak pitching down leg. Herath misses the flick off the hip, and Chakabva, unsighted as he moved to his right, doesn't collect cleanly
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend towards silly point
another big legbreak. Looks like he's not quite used to bowling with the new ball. Pitches outside leg, turns further down, and Herath leaves it alone
straighter one on middle and leg, no turn, worked away gently through midwicket. Asela trots across to the other end and hands it over to Herath
pushed through on off, Herath presses forward, and smothers the ball
similar length, but quicker through the air on off, Herath is tight in defence. Played up to the covers
too straight in line, Herath twirls it away past the left of short midwicket
flatter and skids in from wide of the crease, Asela hangs back and punches a single to wide long-on
caps the first over of the day with a straight ball on off, defended back with a straight bat
loopier and outside off, Asela stretches out and smoothly drives to extra cover
Cremer held this back. Lands it on middle and gets it to break away, Asela stays back, adjusts and keeps it out
dropped short and spins away outside off, Asela steps back and forces the ball to the covers
leg-stump short ball, swatted away to midwicket, who is in the deep. SL exploiting these defensive fields in the early exchanges
there comes the sweep from Ranga Aiya. Legbreak, spins in, he rolls his wrists and sweeps it with control to deep fine leg
dropped short and breaks away outside off, slapped out to sweeper cover for one
sliding into off stump, Asela negotiates it with a forward-defensive
shorter and outside off, stands tall and punches out to cover
length and outside off, Asela leans back and caresses it to the off-side sweeper. Zim sitting back, and SL ticking along
speared flat and just a shade outside off, Herath opens the face and steers it down to third man to bring up SL's 300
pushed through on middle, Herath goes low, and unleashes the reverse sweep, places it square through the off side for one more
nice and full outside off, Asela stretches out, but the ball dips, so he reaches out with his hands and flashes a drive back to Williams
looped up outside off, no real turn, Herath goes low, and happily sweeps it away to long leg
fuller and straighter on off, Asela leans into a drive and directs the ball down to long-off
slides on off stump, Herath presses forward and smothers it. Solid

I thought that was perhaps too full for the reverse, the line is on the stumps as well. Herath dares to reverse sweep and sends it fine of third man. Mpofu covers good ground and saves a couple for his team
shortens his length outside off, faster ball, Herath bunts it into the gap at covers
loose ball on the pads, duly glanced away to long leg
short and angled in on off, poked out to cover
skids into the thigh, faster one, Asela opts to play across the line and misses it. It was definitely bouncing over and sliding down
Asela opens the face and guides this length ball to point
wild ball, speared down leg, Asela overbalances but drags his back foot back in time
pushed through on off, defended back to the bowler on the front foot
back of a length and angled in, no real turn, Asela checks his punch at the last instant, and chips it in the air.... but to the left of short midwicket. Long-on mops it up.
tossed up outside off, Asela employs a strong stride and defends
very full on middle and leg, blocked back down the pitch
slower through the air and dips on leg stump, Asela reads it and knocks it through the vacant spaces at midwicket
skids on outside off, Herath sizes it up and reverse-sweeps it uppishly to third man
hint of turn and bounce but the length is short enough for Asela to skip back and defend it
tossed on off, defended back to the bowler
this one spins in, bounces as well, lobs in front of short leg off the pad
floated up outside off, blocked
pushed through outside off, there's the reverse sweep - Herath's happy place. He places it fine between slip and the keeper
turn and bounce, Herath hangs back and wears it on the thigh
slides on outside off, Herath dares to drive without meeting the pitch. Skews an inside edge that dies in front of short leg
slides on outside off, no turn, Herath looks to launch into an almighty slog sweep. He only gets a thick bottom edge that nutmegs the keeper. First boundary of the day
flighted on middle and leg, easily clipped away to long leg
dug short and outside off, Herath executes the back-foot punch to deep point, high elbow and all
tossed up on middle, hint of turn, defended
there is turn - but it's of the slow variety. Blocked on the back foot
overpitched and outside off, Asela leans into a pretty drive, short cover flings himself to his left to intercept it
full-toss on middle and leg, powerfully whipped to deep midwicket
full and angled in on middle, inside-edged to midwicket
short and wide outside off, jumps back and cuts it to point
flat on off, whipped away past the right of short midwicket. Sensible batting from these two

Williams wins an lbw verdict. Herath then challenges the on-field out decision. The left-arm spinner serves up a low full-toss. Herath had jumped across off and missed the sweep wearing it on his front pad, well below the knee-roll. Impact: this looks in line with off. No signs of a snick. This should crash into off stump. The tracker returns umpire's call on impact, but suggests the ball would head past the off stump. Oh my! How did that miss? Beats me. The drift in the air wasn't sharp either. Eventually, umpire Gould's call is reversed. Williams is bewildered, so am I. Herath can afford a wry smile

Chakabva fumbles once. Twice. But still has enough time to swipe the bails off hurriedly. Herath has to exit now. He dashes down the track, Williams pushes it flatter and wider outside off. The ball dips, which means the batsman can't squeeze it out. Herath misses the ball by a long distance. Chakabva makes a mess but cleans it up on the third attempt to break the stand
short and outside off, steps back and forces the ball square through the off side
googly, starts outside off and breaks back in sharply, Lakmal has no clue about it and jabs it bat down hurriedly
full on middle, defended
full on middle, another forward-defensive
dropped short and outside off, Asela steps back and cracks it through the covers
full on middle, another forward-defensive
dropped short and outside off, punched to long-off. Asela trusts Lakmal and takes the single
skids into the pad, off the pad and rolls to short leg
big turn for Williams. Pitches around off and rips away, Lakmal jabs at it with hard hands, plays away from the body, and sends a thick edge past slip
this one slides in with the arm on off, defended back
skids into leg stump, and raps the thigh
short on off, goes back and punches a single to mid-on hanging back. Lakmal puts in a full-stretch dive and secures a single
rank half-tracker outside off, bad hamstring and all, Asela nimbly jumps back and cracks it away square through the off- side gap as the ball purrs away to the boundary
quick fizzer outside off, breaks away, pushed to cover
looped up, angled in, pops up off the pad and lands on the pitch
slides on outside off, Lakmal plays a wafty drive back to the bowler
Lakmal presses forward and squeezes a full one to cover
another long hop on off or just outside off, Lakmal picks the length up quickly. He rocks back and pulls it fiercely over midwicket
Cremer responds with a ripper! It starts on off and breaks away past the outside edge. The length was full, drawing Lakmal forward, winking at the batsman, and nearly kissing the outside edge
lobbed up on off, forward-defensive
full on middle and leg, Asela responds with a dead bat
short and wide outside off, goes on the back foot and lashes it to sweeper cover. Asela hobbles across for one
flatter and faster on off, punched back to him
stretches out and drives a full ball back to the bowler
slides on outside off, bunted down to long-off
inside edged to the right of short leg
really full on off, Asela collapses his back leg and drives inside-out to cover
pitches on off and spins away with extra bounce, dabbed to point with soft hands
fractionally short on off, Asela hurtles back and swats it to deep midwicket

slower through the air on leg stump, breaks away just enough with bounce. Lakmal dares to play against the spin, and only lobs a leading edge back to the bowler. Cremer clings onto the overhead catch. Asela isn't pleased
really full and outside off, squeezed out to cover
short and outside off, camps back and punches the ball to cover
swept from a middle-stump line to fine leg. Asela farms the strike
Asela resumes with a forward-defensive as this was flighted on middle
slides on outside off, dabbed gently to cover
short and wide outside off, goes back gingerly and punches a single to the right of point
nice and full on off, and Kumara keeps it out
big-turning legbreak, 78ks, lavishly beats the outside edge
full on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket. Asela continues to farm the strike
tossed on off, defended
slides on middle and leg, whipped through the vacant spaces at midwicket, but Asela keeps strike
Asela dances down the track, eyes up a loft over cover. But only squeezes it along the ground to that fielder
really full on off, shuffles across off, drops down to one knee, and sweeps a single to long leg
flat delivery on off, Gunaratne stays in his crease to defend
generous flight on that one. Gunaratne strides forward to block
flat again outside off, another block. The requisite half-over defense is done. Now the over starts
works this down to short fine leg.
gets down for the slog sweep but Williams fires one in very full outside off. Excellently bowled. Goes under the bat
a full toss is bunted back to the bowler and that's a maiden. Well done from Williams
more flight on off and middle, Kumara gets his front pad well out of the line and defends
plenty of flight outside off, driven to mid-off
there goes the patience and determination, out the window. Loopy legbreak on middle, Kumara looks to send this to the SSC. Inside-edges into his pad
driven to mid-off again.
may have been the googly, but Kumara gets forward and blocks easily enough
another googly on middle, Kumara uses his long reach to get right forward to defend
a slow delivery on leg from over the wicket, inside-edged to fine leg.
another loopy delivery on leg, defended. Negative lines
another dead-bat smother
flat on off, kept out
flat, wide, short, mis-timed to cover
another maiden. Three on the bounce. Flat delivery outside off, Gunaratne looks to paddle this away, but gets no bat on that. Struck on the pad, but well outside the line.
googly outside off, Kumara stays back to defend
runs down the pitch and looks to whack this over long-on, the legbreak rips in and takes the inside edge towards fine leg. Two, asks Kumara? Excuse me, exclaims Gunaratne

and that's Cremer's five-for! A lead of 10 for Zimbabwe. Pushes this one through, flatter and quicker outside off. Gunaratne stays back. The ball skids on, kisses the inside edge and clatters into the stumps. A crucial hand from Gunaratne.
nice start from Lakmal. You won't get much swing, but that line is terrific. On a length, on a fourth-stump channel, blocked from the crease
good length around off, another nice defensive push from the crease
some width, and that's Zimbabwe's first runs of the innings. Masakadza stays back and punches a back-foot drive through cover. Lovely hit. Didn't look to over-hit that
131 kph, good length around off, kept out again
better length with the new ball. Full and wide outside off, left alone
much better. Inviting a drive with a fuller length, to which Masakadza says long day ahead. Left alone. Some outward shape on that
slow on off, 77 kph. Right on target. Outside-halved to third man
that's a nice stroke. Slightly short outside off, a hint of width, but Chakabva laces a cut through point. Important to play some strokes
out comes the 'phew' during delivery stride. Full outside off, no turn. Inside-edged into the pad
slow again on off, Chakabva gets nicely forward to defend
that's risky. I'm going to say poor stroke. Flat on off, straight. Chakabva goes back and pushes to the sweeper cover. Too much risk
a nice forward press to smother that loopy delivery
back of a length outside off, on a fourth-stump line. Chakabva is slightly hurried for pace, but defends

did he try to play that? Yes, says umpire Llong. Good length down leg, Chakabva looks to flick that, takes the thigh pad and to the fine leg boundary. Lifted his bat up as to say 'I'm not playing a stroke;, but he was, and so four leg byes.
good length outside off, no stroke
that's good. Good length, or just fuller than that, outside off. Not enough width to cut. Left
beautiful line. Just around off on a length. Forces Chakabva to play, defended
129 kph, leg side-ish, nudged down to fine leg

that's terrific bowling. No chance for Chakabva. Herath slows this way down, but drags the length back too. Pitches on middle. Chakabva plays the line - it's the new ball after all. There is just enough turn and the ball spins to hit the off stump. The top of off. Chakabva didn't miss that by much, but by enough. Beauty. Unplayable.
flight on off, driven back to the bowler
fuller and straight, easily blocked
quicker and leg side-ish, inside-edged into short leg's hands
slow on off, blocked
ooh, nicely bowled. Flat on off, shortish. Musakanda gets forward and inside-edges into the pad. 'Not out,' says the umpire to everyone's surprise. No one appealed.
on a length around off, moves away slightly. But easily defended
131 kph, good length around middle, pushed away to mid-off. Elegant stroke
lovely hit. Fullish and wide outside off, driven languidly in front of deep point. The sub Gunathilaka dives but can't stop two
on a length on middle, pushed to mid-on
a good change in length. Digs this one in short. Masakadza gets underneath that
slightly spongy. Good length outside off, bunted to mid-on
on the pads, down leg, worked to midwicket
beautiful bowling. Drags this length back, this one skids on. Beaten on the inside edge, struck on the pad, but sliding down
quicker on leg, defended

another wicket. Herath on fire before lunch. Plenty of flight on off, loopy in fact. Musakanda hasn't had anything to be aggressive to so he eyes up this one. Looks to, inexplicably I might add, drag a flick through midwicket. The ball gets enough turn to take the outside edge. Lobs straight to slip. Not a good option at all, at least go straight
flight outside off, Ervine strides forward but the ball spins in, hits Ervine outside the line
nice use of the feet, it's a proper defensive shot, but plenty of intent. Defended
flat and quick on leg, flicked to square leg
quick on off, no turn. Outside-halved towards point
quicker outside off, flat trajectory, no turn. Chopped towards point
fuller, closer to the stumps. Ervine gets forward and defends
a nice gentle press forward to block
85 kph, on the pads on leg, worked away towards midwicket. Dilruwan gets across to prevent one

bludgeoned back. Waaaatcchh out. Flight on off, Masakadza comes down, gets to the pitch and muscles a powerful drive at the stumps at the bowler's end. The off stump for the right-hander was uprooted, and almost hit the umpire.

given out lbw. Masakadza reviews. Doesn't look like bat or glove. This could come down to just impact. It's full outside off, Masakadza chooses to sweep but doesn't make contact, I think. Multiple replays to see if there is some glove. It's mighty close. Does it just flick it? Can't really tell, one way or another. So that can't be overturned on that aspect. UltraEdge or Snick or some kind would have done the job perfectly. But that debate is for another time. Three reds on HawkEye. And they're three down already.
gets across the stumps, and pushes a drive towards cover for a run
top-edged, but lands short of the 45-degree fielder at fine leg. Flat on off, Ervine tries to sweep
more flight outside off, a thick outside edge towards third man for one
flatter and quicker outside off, no stroke
flight on off, smothered back
quicker and shorter on middle. Ervine picks the length early, goes back and pummels a mis-timed pull through midwicket. That's important to do

another one. Zimbabwe go to lunch at 23 for 4. Not a good stroke at all. Flat and wide outside off, Dilruwan gets some turn. Ervine has a poke at that, and just dabs it straight to slip. Tried to pull out of the stroke late, but at this level, your decision-making ability has to be quicker and just better. Ervine's is not in this instance. A half-leave, half-dab results in sooo much pressure after lunch.
floated up on middle, no real turn, Raza goes low, and sweeps it with intent. Secures a single to fine leg
much fuller and outside off, Williams lunges out and drives the ball handsomely through cover point
skids into the pads, blocked off the back foot to short leg
fizzes through outside off, holds its line, no shot
Williams stretches forward to meet the pitch of a full ball outside off. Driven to mid-off
nice and full on off, non-turner, smothered back
full and skidding in towards the pads, worked defensively to forward short leg
another slider outside off, too wide to draw a shot from Williams
on a length and outside off, dinked into cover, and they take on Herath's creaky knees for a single
straight ball on middle, pushed to cover from the crease
full and spins away outside off from around the wicket, punched to sweeper
Raza shows intent again, advances down the track and pushes this straight ball to cover
slides into the pads, full, picked off to the right of short leg to square leg
dropped short and wide outside off, Williams jumps back and smears it to sweeper cover
short on middle and leg, cramps Raza for room. He hurtles back and forces the ball to mid-on
flat and width outside off, Williams camps back and punches it sweetly square through the off side. Laced it
full and just a shade outside off, dabbed wide of silly point
backs away outside leg and drills a full one down to long-off
tossed up liberally on off, dead-batted
floated up outside off, this spits off the footmarks, and bounces past the outside edge
wide of the crease and Herath gets it to hold its line outside off, skims past the outside edge again
short and angling across off, square-cut away for one
straight ball on middle, great accuracy from Dilruwan, defended back on the front foot
skids on off, opens the face and bunts the ball towards point
short offbreak outside off, cut firmly to the off-side sweeper on the back foot
short and outside off, punched out to sweeper
full and angled in from over the wicket, defended to short leg
reverse-swept from outside off past slip. Third man is not fine enough
Williams ventures a reverse but does not make contact and is rapped high on the thigh
full, holds its line on off, Williams prefers to block off the back foot
shorter on off, whipped away off the back foot to deep midwicket
Raza gallops down the track, takes a really full ball from off, and belts it down to long-off
flighted just a shade outside off, kept out
Raza pre-meditates a paddle-sweep. Drops down to one knee and top-edges it towards fine leg
drifts in from wide of the crease, hits the pad, but this was clearly going down leg. Dickwella pulls off the Sangappeal
flatter on middle and leg, hastily defended
slower and loopier on leg stump, push-driven to mid-on
straight length ball on off, driven on the front foot, but the man at short extra cover throws himself to his right to stop the ball
this drifts into the right-hander, fuss-free defence back to the bowler
tossed outside off, pushed on the front foot through vacant extra cover. Lovely stride to counter the spin
fired on off from over the wicket, Raza ventures a reverse-sweep. He pre-meditated, as did Karunaratne at slip, nimbly moving across to his right from first slip but only finger-tipped it away
flighted and outside off, Williams stretches forward and eases it through the gap at cover
speared on off, confidently whipped to midwicket
marginally short and outside off, whipped out to deep midwicket for one
tossed on middle, defended back to the bowler
lovely batting. Short, but not very wide, primarily because of that skidding angle from around the wicket. Williams stays low and cuts behind point for a couple.
on the pads, flicked to wide mid-on for a run. This is excellent batting post lunch. Proactive, despite the risk
slower and shorter, Raza stays back and defends in front of off stump
nicely done. Against the spin, or whatever little is there. Raza bottom-hands that drive through cover. Races away.
and now the paddle sweep, low enough, premeditated. A run to fine leg. Got to get behind the stroke, and not drag a paddle sweep.
slower and fuller outside off, outside-halved to third man
tossed up on leg, Raza clears his front foot and drives to long-off
plenty of drift. Flat outside off, skids on with the arm. A thick outside edge to third man

surprise, surprise. Just kidding. That was on the cards. That's sensational bowling. Tossed up outside off, lulls Williams into a drive. He has been scoring there all session long. So why not this time? He drives and Herath's wiles take that ball ripping through bat and pad. Knocks into the stumps. This is Test cricket, setting him up with several drifty deliveries and then gets one to spin. How does he do it?
tossed up on off, driven towards cover.
Raza runs to the pitch and drives to long-off. Good batting.
overpitched flight on leg, blocked back. Terrific over.
full and holds its line on off, Raza presses forward and pushes the ball to cover
pushed through on off from around the wicket, blocked solidly on the front foot
skids through on off, defended on the back foot now
straighter one, forward and smothered
Dilruwan shortens his length on off, defended back to him
Moor opens the face and directs this full ball through cover point
drifts in from wide of the crease, pings the front pad, but this was heading down leg
full around off, much slower through the air, dabbed to cover
this is the straighter one, Moor employs a long stride and defends it
low-arm slider, fizzes in, takes the inside edge and rolls wide of short leg
hangs it up on middle, straightens his line, blocked on the front foot
faster, flatter one, skids on off, Moor simply covers up in defence
banged in short and climbs on top of off, nearly 140ks, hurriedly jabbed to cover
just short of a good length on off, 138ks, punchily blocked back
Kumara hits 140ks now but this is shorter and attached with width outside off, crunched to sweeper
hip-high short ball on off, Raza jumps off his feet and flicks the ball away square of fine leg
chest-high short ball on middle, half-flapped and half-fended over square leg. Kumara has the pace to harry batsmen
wild, wild bouncer. 140ks, flies off the deck and past the ducking batsman and the leaping keeper. Five wides. Pace is your friend, pace is your enemy

Oh, the ball keeps sliding away from Rangana. But he gamely chases it down running across to his right and tumbling at sweeper cover. It always looks very awkward when the old chap dives, right? But excellent commitment. Shortish and just a shade outside off, punched away. Rangana just pulls it in and earns the applause of Kumara
drifting across off from around the stumps, pushed down to long-off off the front foot
loopier and outside off from over the wicket to Raza, defended back
slides into the pads, milked away to the right of forward short leg
drifts and turns into the pad, but this was breaking down leg
Moor goes back to defend this length ball wide of short leg
Moor winds up for a maasssive slog-sweep but only connects with a whole lot of thin air as the ball drifts across the right-hander
short on leg stump, cramps Raza for room, 142ks, worked away to the right of short midwicket. They hare across for the single
attempted bouncer, angling away outside off from around the wicket, the batsman ducks under it though the ball did not rise
short on middle, stays leg side of the ball and punches to mid-off
shoulder-high lifter on the leg stump, Moor manages to evade it
rising short ball, chest-hunting ball on middle, Moor pats it down onto the pitch after rising with it
half-volley angling away outside off - to follow a volley of lifter - Moor opens the face and square-drives it away for three as Chameera fumbles in the deep
a flat start on leg, to which Moor goes back and blocks
flight on off, Moor strides forward to defend
slow again, short enough though, allowing Moor to go back and defend comofrtably

it's a good option, but it's not good execution. Some would disagree. The best place to hit it. Between the keeper's legs. Flat outside off, Moor looks for a big slog sweep and under-edges the ball between Dickwella's legs. Umpire Gould asks the batsman if he hit it. Four runs
defended into the leg side
quicker outside off, a crisp drive to cover.
nice length. Ribcage attacking length, from around the length. Worked towards short fine leg
good length on leg, clipped to midwicket
good length, around off. He stays in the crease and defends, head over the ball, eyes on it
good length on leg. Raza is forced off his feet, but easily and capably defended
not a bad line occasionally. Well down leg, an ODI wide. Raza leaves. Often gloved to the keeper, like Faf du Plessis at Trent Bridge
looking for the yorker, goes astray slightly. A low full toss bunted to mid-on ends a maiden
short and straight, defended back
slightly fuller, still straight. Moor can defend off the back foot
brings Moor forward with a loopy legbreak, driven back
nice length, on the pads. Brings Moor forward. Played away easily
83 kph, loopy offbreak outside off, driven to cover. Nice over. More control from Sri Lanka after drinks
on the pads, flicked away through midwicket
good length, and straight. A solid block off the back foot. Kumara has definitely pushed both batsmen back. There is no slip for the 1-2
back of a length on leg, kept out
digs this in, a non-threatening bouncer loops over the ducking Moor. Comfortable
leg side-ish, nudged away towards short leg's right. Mendis stops one. Well done.
my word. A 135 kph beamer to Moor who gets whacked on the hand. Right on the glove. He seems fine. An immediate apology. Looking for the yorker. One warning for Kumara.
stays on his half of the pitch this time. On a length around off, blocked
immediately comes charging at Herath, works one down to long-on for a run. Well done
Zimbabwe's lead is now 100. Off the pad towards fine leg. Slightly leg side-ish, the slider
slow on middle and leg, asking to hit through midwicket. Raza says maybe later. Dead-batted
accepts the invitation this time. A better choice. This is shorter on leg, so Raza goes back and flicks through midwicket. More control
runs down and bunts one to long-on
shorter on leg, punched to long-on from the back foot. Six riskless runs of the over. What the what?
oh legspinning tripe. Love it. Short and wide from Mendis, hammered through cover for a couple. Herath forced to foot-stop it on the boundary
more filth. A long-hop on middle and leg, short and slow. Moor pulls merrily over midwicket. Good batting. Using the bad balls
there is the one odd good ball of the over. The legbreak doesn't spin much outside off, kept out
on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
flipped away to fine leg. An easy run
full on middle and leg, defensive block
Dickwella sees Raza shaping for a paddle and moves early. Raza, though, converts a full delivery into a full toss and paddles that down to fine leg for a brace
another paddle. Fine leg has moved finer. So just one.
worked into the leg side, to midwicket
flight on leg, gets Moor forward. Blocked
pushed back to the bowler
quicker, pushed through, Moor reads the length early, goes back and defends
flight on leg, Raza solidly blocks
overpitched flight on middle, driven to cover, who is slightly deep. I rather have him closer for the uppish drive
flat and wide outside off, swivel-driven to the sweeper cover
nicely driven to cover off that overpitched delivery
occasionally, the ball sticks in the hand for far too long, making legspin a very difficult art. Like this. Short and wide, slapped to the sweeper cover
an ODI wide to the left-hander. Yikes, that was very wide down the leg side. Raza, shaped to paddle, is forced to stretch to get bat on that. He does, a run to fine leg. Better over from Mendis

the reverse sweep goes straight to slip. But the fielder anticipates the shot and moves to his right to stop that stroke, or even catch it. This takes the top edge and goes for four through what is, unfortunately for Sri Lanka, the vacant slip region
defended back
this cross-batted unorthodoxy is troubling Sri Lanka. A flighted delivery down leg, Raza nails his fine sweep. Got enough power behind that
and now steps out to meet the ball as it pitches. Once he's there, he gets underneath the length and lifts the ball over midwicket. Herath who?
flat down leg, solidly kept out
78 kph, flight down leg, inside-edged towards square leg. 12 runs off that.
flight on off, Moor stretched out to defend
gets right back into the crease and push to the sweeper cover
shortish, pitches just outside off. Not close enough to cut. Raza chops this towards slip
more free runs. A very full delivery down leg, Raza gets a bit of bat on his one-handed sweep to fine leg
quicker through the air outside off, pushed to cover
shortish outside off, punched away to long-off
fullish delivery, 124 kph loosener in pace. Straight. Moor gets behind the line nicely
more runs. Run. Good length down leg, flicked away down to fine leg for a single
nicely bowled. 129 kph, in the channel outside off. Raza defends off the back foot
a short delivery. Bouncer on middle, Raza ducks underneath
well-directed bouncer. More towards off, not as high as the previous one. Raza takes his eyes off the ball and awkwardly keeps it out
132 kph, good length delivery around off, blocked.
nice and full around off, Moor presses forward to defend
88 kph, Moor stays back this time and gets his bat behind the line
flat outside off, pushed to cover
nicely bowled. More flight, more loop on off. Moor has no trouble in keeping that out
82 kph, driven away through cover, a run to the sweeper
lots of flight down leg, swept away down to fine leg for a run.
he starts off with a loose, full ball on the pads, which is neatly picked off to the right of short midwicket
tighter line on off stump, defended back to Lakmal
back of a length and angling into the thigh, he plays across the line and misses a flick. Slanting down leg but they run across for a leg bye
full and on off, shuffles across off and turns the ball to short midwicket
very full on middle, Raza walks down the track, applies pressure on Tharanga at mid-off. Drills it to the right of Tharanga, and sets off for one. Excellent cricket for these two batsmen
back of a length and holds its line just a shade outside off, stroked to cover on the front foot
slides on outside off, swished to cover with a flat bat
good length and turns into the batsman, pushed solidly to cover now. No violence

Raza raises his fifty with a sweet drive. He reaches the landmark in only 62 balls. Another crucial hand from him. This was slightly overpitched and outside off, Raza presses forward and eases it in the gap between cover and mid-off. He hares back for three
tapped into the covers off the front foot
turning offbreak, starts outside off and spins back in, Moor prods and ekes out an inside edge onto the pad
this one drifts away outside off, drags the batsman forward and zips past the outside edge
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to short extra
back of a length and outside off, punched to Dilruwan at cover
very full and slanted in on middle, Raza plays around his front pad and ends up squirting an inside edge to square leg
tailing into the pads, merrily clipped away to long leg
back of a length and keeps low outside off, a jabbing punch to cover ensues
floaty short ball outside off, the batsman arches his back and lets it pass
length ball, angled in, defended back to him
tossed-up offbreak, defended back again
loopier and outside off, pushed up to cover on the front foot
flatter and faster outside off, crisply punched to the same fielder
Dilruwan finds some drift in the air but this is negotiated off the front foot
Moor opens the face and directs the ball to the left of cover for one

full and wide outside off, Moor goes after it and flashes a drive through backward point. Mathews runs to his left from sweeper, tumbles, but was in contact with the ad boards while aiming to swat the ball back into play. The result is four
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, capably defended to cover
shoulder-high short ball on off stump, which is flapped - not a proper pull - away to deep square leg
just short of a good length and outside off, stands tall and punches through cover point
short and outside off, opens up his hips, and pulls it firmly to deep midwicket
length ball around off, opens the face and dinks it to Karunaratne at wide slip
Dilruwan held this one back outside off, checks his punch and hits it to long-off
Raza runs down the track but isn't close enough to the pitch, and ends up dead-batting it quietly
Raza falls over and sweeps, extra bounce, the batsman sends a top-edge in front of long leg
flatter and quicker outside off, stands tall and punches a single to long-off
some hesitation between the wickets, and they settle with a dot. This offbreak is worked past the right of midwicket
length ball on middle, defended back

Kumara returns and provides SL with the breakthrough! He roars and is flanked by his captain. This was dug in short on off stump, 137.1ks, Moor does not need a second invitation to pull. But square leg isn't on the boundary. He is about 20 metres in, Moor hits it straight into the lap of Danushka, who is subbing for Asela. Moor sinks to his knees and drags himself off the field. Was the leg-side trap a plan from Chandimal and Kumara?
very full and tailing down leg, reverse for Kumara, Cremer is left overbalanced, and the ball rolls away past the keeper. Five byes. Was there a snick onto it? No, says the umpire.
slanted down leg past the glance
wide of the crease, length ball, angling in, reversing in, grazes the inside edge and wanders away to midwicket
Kumara runs in hard and hits the deck hard, back of a length on off, defended off the back foot
Kumara ventures a bouncer outside off, the batsman sways his upper body out of the way and lets it go
tossed-up offbreak, Raza squirts an inside edge to leg, having not met the pitch
slides on outside off, Raza misses the reverse sweep and is pinned outside the line
full on middle, defended back towards the bowler
starts outside off and breaks in, Raza gets forward and smothers it
skidding into the pads, whipped with the angle to deep midwicket
short offbreak, whipped away with the spin to the midwicket boundary. Waller picked the length early and dispatched it
bouncer, angled in from wide of the crease, soars over the ducking batsman. Wide called for height
regally driven on the up by Raza. This was a length ball outside off - not a half-volley - he eases forward and punchily drives it in the gap at cover. Crunchhhhed
full and on off, drilled to cover
full and wide outside off, shovel-driven towards deep point
deflected off the hips to long leg
short and tails in on middle, Waller stays leg-side of the ball and punches to cover
Waller stands tall, meets this short ball outside off, and solidly punches to short cover
the batsman saunters down the track, yorks himself outside off, and jabs it to point
slower through the air on off, Raza presses forward and defends to cover
straighter one on off, Raza strides out again, patting it to the same fielder
slides in on middle, defended back to him
Raza dashes down the track, takes a full ball from outside off and hammers it to extra cover
tossed outside off, opens the face and square-drives the ball through point
on a length and slanted down leg, Waller can't connect with a glance
short and outside off, stands up tall, gets on top of the bounce,  and creams it away past the left of cover. The ball purrs away to the boundary

back of a length and reverses in, skewed in the gap between the two short midwickets. A direct hit at the non-striker's end from Danushka could have had Raza. It could have been tighter had the bowler backed up as well
back of a length and outside off, jabbed to cover
slower ball, overpitched and wide outside off, Waller lays into it and disdainfully clouts it through the covers
yorker outside off, it can't be dug out. Top ball to end a wayward over
length ball, drifts in on middle, stabbed back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed on off, blocked to cover
skids on off, chopped from the stumps to sweeper cover
flighted just a shade outside off, Waller unfurls a delectable drive to sweeper
floated full and outside off, flashes and skews an outside edge wide of backward point
straight ball on off, stretches forward and taps it to mid-off
very full and slanted in on off, neatly flicked away to deep square leg
back of a length on off, defended off the back foot
off-stump yorker, dug out with an angled bat
short and rising outside off, fended to cover. Waller is eager to get the strike but Raza sends him back
bouncer, flies past the left shoulder as the batsman ducks
wide of the crease, zips in on middle, jabbed down to mid-on

short non-turning offbreak outside off, jumps back and flays a cut to the left of deep backward point. Herath throws himself to his left near the boundary but accidentally kicks the ball away to the rope
tossed up, drifts away, pokes an outside edge past the right of slip
tight line on off, defended back
starts outside off and spins in a touch, defended back again
really full on off, shovelled away to wide long-on
slower through the air on middle, kept out
Raza comes down the track and quietly defends it to off
floated up outside off, down the track, but he's beaten in flight. Scythes a drive over extra cover
full on middle, stays leg-side of the ball and carves it to point
flighted on the leg stump, hangs back and blocks
flighted outside the leg stump, Waller drops down to one knee and sweeps it away fine of Lakmal at deep square leg
short and turns away outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
slow outside off, spinning in. Waller looks to punch that through cover, but mis-times it  back
opens the bat face and guides this through deep backward point for a single
nicely flicked away through midwicket for a couple. Tharanga hurtles towards the ball from deep square leg and stops two with an excellent diving stop
comes down and yorks himself. Jams that out
driven against the spin, tossed up outside off, finds cover
flatter on middle, worked to midwicket
wow, takes a leg stump ball, opens the bat face and guides that through point. That's terrific batting.
flat and straight, punched to cover.
this is fuller and slower on off, Raza gets right forward to defend
excellent stop. Strays down leg, flicked away towards fine leg, except leg slip gets to his left to save runs
more slowness through the air, loopy. Raza defends
driven back to the bowler. Another tidy over easily negotiated
that's a risky shot. Flighted outside off, Waller tries to drive against the spin. Hits it back to the bowler
much better option. Flat and straight, Waller punches to long-on from the back foot
flat outside off, pushed through. Defended
tossed up outside off, Raza shimmies down, meets the ball as it pitches and drives to cover. Excellent shot
driven with the spin to long-on
flat, full, straight. Waller shuffles across, opens the bat face late.
awesome stroke-making against one of the best in the world. Raza runs down and flicks over midwicket. Knew what he wanted all along. No chance for long-on running around

over long-on. I'm going to say that's not a good shot. But well, he gets six, so he won't care. He runs down again, looks to hit that over midwicket again, but this is wider outside off. So to drag that is fraught with risk. Skews over the pulled-in boundary at long-on
a solid block this time
slower and straight, driven back awkwardly. Herath pulled the length back on that
that's high-percentage cricket from Raza. Just pushes this down to long-on. Good game awareness after a mistake
76 kph, slow down leg, Waller misses his sweep and is struck on the pad. Pitched well outside leg.
driven with the spin to short midwicket
pushed through, quick on off. Some spin in. A solid block
sensational running. Flat outside off, reverse-swept to Herath at deep point. It's straight to him, but Herath waits for the ball to come to him. So Raza says why not the second run?
sliced off the open face to deep point. Just one this time
goes right back to defend
too much width. Short and wide outside off, carved to deep point
slow down leg, kept out easily enough
down leg again, a bit of a leading edge pops back up the pitch. Waller closes the bat face early
awesome from Raza. Waller drives to mid-on and says 'yeah', Raza doesn't even look where it has gone, blind trust and the run is easily made
fullish on off, Raza gets forward to defend
did that carry to slip? Looks like it did. But was off the pad anyway. Raza shimmies down, but Herath pulls his length back to ensure Raza isn't to the pitch
flat and wide outside off, slapped to cover
plenty of flight outside off, Waller smothers the spin
cut in front of deep point. Flat and wide, slapped away. Herath has to trudge across.
going after the tiring bowlers now. Lots of flight outside off, Waller gets underneath the length and picks the area of his slog sweep. Over midwicket, four
quick on leg, another solid defensive stroke
pushed wider outside off to entice an expansive drive. Mis-timed to cover
80 kph, inside-edge saves Waller. Flight outside off, the ball turning back in. Strikes Waller in front of off. But bat saves him.
flight on off, easily kept out
loopy, overpitched on leg. Picked away to long-on for one

beautiful shot. Plays with the spin. Flight on leg and middle, Waller gets inside the line and lifts the ball nonchalantly over mid-off. Made it look easy, it wasn't. The benefits of confidence in sport
flat down leg, swept away to short fine leg
just short of silly point. Waller closes the bat face too early again. This one pops away towards silly point. Lands short
swept away again, finds short fine leg
good length outside off, gentle seam movement back in. Raza stands in the crease and punches to the sweeper cover
lovely shot. Width outside off, Waller laces a square drive to deep point. Another run
fullish delivery on off, kept out easily
fullish delivery around off, driven to cover. Chandimal stops the run
fullish delivery, seaming back in. 131 kph. Driven to cover
eeks, signs of how slow this surface is. Dug in on middle and off, almost balloons to the batsman. Defended
flat down leg, Waller misses a pull. Struck on the pad
loads of flight on leg, asking Waller if he wants to sweep. Not currently
yes, now. Flat down leg, swept to deep backward square leg. There is short fine leg for that top-edged sweep
77 kph, swept away to short fine leg
top-edged sweep towards deep square leg. Flat down leg again.
79 kph, quick down leg, popped up towards silly point. Hard hands.
full outside off, blocked to cover
well-directed bouncer but too slow, due to the surface. Rolls his wrists on that, to fine leg
nicely done. Back of a length outside off, dabbed past gully. Herath has to run around again. Two more
good length outside off, plonked to cover
thumped through cover. Full outside off, Waller drives between cover and mid-off. All timing. Brings up a crucial half-century
a very short, loopy, nothing bouncer loops over Waller's head
nicely hit. Well-timed sweep to deep backward square leg
slow on leg, kept out
driven to cover, stays inside the line
that's short down leg, pulled away to square leg. Not a good ball, surely signs of fatigue
flicked down towards short fine leg
shimmies down at Herath and jams his bat and pad together to shut out the ball
hammered away. Full and wide outside off, Waller laces a thumping drive to the deep cover fielder
another easy single. Good length outside off, pushed to that deep fielder at cover
135 kph, driven to Chandimal at cover.
fullish delivery outside off, blocked away
short outside off, Waller gets underneath that
138 kph, inside-edge or not? Yes, says umpire Llong. Full on leg, the ball hits the pad. Looked like an inside edge
right in front. Somehow Raza gets bat on that. Inside-edged towards square leg
comes right down and defends. Excellent defensive stroke
terrific fielding from Chandimal. Driven towards midwicket, where Chandimal dives to his left and saves a run
gets right forward to defend
worked towards midwicket
smothers the spin again by lunging forward and blocking
139 kph, good length delivery on leg, Waller misses a flick and is struck on the thigh pad. Kumara asks the question, but is quickly struck down by Llong. Big edge too
is there some reverse swing? Good length around leg, seams back in and hits Waller on the body again. Ricochets towards gully. Raza calls him through
digs this in outside off, Raza comfortably avoids that
nicely bowled. Goes full this time, 143 kph, on off. Driven up to mid-off
141 kph, beautifully hit to cover. Straight to the fielder though
a slower ball to finish, on off, 111 kph. Kept out comfortably.
punched up to cover from the crease
lots of flight outside off, defended towards cover. Raza refuses the run
driven towards the bowler's right. He dives and parries it away for one
83 kph, driven against the spin again to cover
shimmies down, not anywhere near the pitch but skews it away past midwicket. Convincingly done in by flight
more flight outside off, kept out
getting this ball to tail back in late. Full and straight, driven up to mid-on. Excellent bowling
full and wide outside off, square driven to the sweeper cover

just opens that bat face so late. Easier because it's a slow surface. Good length on the body. Lets the ball come to him before opening the face to find a gap through gully. One of the shots of the day. This ball is tailing back in
full and straight, blocked
drifts well down leg. 138 kph. An ODI wide
good length outside off, pushed away to the sweeper cover to keep strike
tossed up outside off, driven to the sweeper cover. One more
still happy to get right to the pitch with his feet. Gets there and defends
excellent bowling. Flat on off, but not full or short. Raza keeps it out
wow. Moves to 96. Runs down and drives over cover. That is belligerence. Not even to the pitch of the ball. Went through with the stroke
gets low and paddles away to fine leg to move to 97. His job is done for the day. Fantastic effort
tossed up on off, solidly and efficiently kept out.

good length, pushed through flat outside off stump. Driven on the up to sweeper's right...they come back for the second. Herath puts in a nice throw and the bowler takes the bails off at the non-strikers. Sent upstairs but Waller had grounded his bat nicely

pushes it through cover point to bring up his hundred. Maiden Test hundred for Raza and he hasn't taken long. Back of a length outside off, rocks back, pushes it square through the off side and screams in delight
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, gets to the pitch and drives to long-on
good length outside off, defended into the side
full and drifted wide outside off, leans in and opens the face to push this to deep point
goes for the yorker first up, misses his length. Slight inswing on this low full toss. Tucked off the inside half of the bat to midwicket...who misfields. Mid-on forced to clean up
good length, starts outside off, tails back in. Driven confidently on the up, straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and angled into the pads. Goes deep in the crease and offers the full face to push this back past his partner
full and angled down leg side, through to the keeper
full at off stump, driven firmly to mid-off. Raza has seen the marginal swing. Short strides in response
good length, pushed down leg side, tucked fine off the pad, attempted flick
