good length, drifted in at middle stump, defended into the off side
good length, middle stump, solid forward defence
good length, drifted outside leg, reaches for it and pushes to long-on
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the off side off the back foot
good length, middle stump, exposes the off stump as he presses forward and defends
full and down the leg side, might have taken the pad on it's way to the keeper, attempted flick
short ball at middle stump, doesn't quite climb. Raza is hopping, but he's got it covered. Drops it into the turf
full and into the pads, tucked uppishly to deep square leg
short ball on middle stump, rises slowly again. Nicely on top of this and drops it into the off side with soft hands
good length, angled into the pads, watchfully pushed to short midwicket
there's that swing again. Full and tailing in from outside off. Skews the cover drive off the outside half of the bat, straight to extra cover
god length at middle stump, tucked into the midwicket region off the back foot, bit of hesitation but through for the run
shot. Length, wide outside off stump. Puts in a big stride, expands his arms and slaps it to sweeper's right
oh well bowled. Gets this full one to dip on middle stump, draws him into the drive and beats him in flight. Thick outside edge on the drive, trickles to short third man
good length, leg stump, defended down the pitch
well played. Skips down the track, meets it on the full on leg stump, drives to long-on
good length at off stump, driven on the up, with the turn, to sweeper cover
good length, swinging in at off stump. Waller walks across early, nearly chips it to deep square

big appeal and it's given not out. Gould, the umpire. It's been reviewed. Waller walked across a long way and was struck on the pad as he looked to flick. Swinging, angling ball hit him on leg stump. There seemed to be bat and it also seemed to be going down...yep. It is going down. Long way with that swing.
bouncer at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and somehow, even with all that leg side support for the bowler's angle, he has found the boundary. Tickles it fine from his chest
good length, angled into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
full and just outside off, driven sweetly to mid-off's left
full at middle stump, front leg well out of the way as he pokes this to short midwicket
good length, pushed flat and down leg side, glanced to deep square leg
full at off stump, driven to mid-off, watchfully
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length, middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
good length at leg stump, shows the middle and off stump, defends into the off side. Takes some guts to play like that against Herath in Sri Lanka. Or the pitch is just that good
full outside off stump, opens up, drives to sweeper cover
offcutter. Good length, in the corridor, pushed to extra cover on the up
back of a length on off stump, opens the face and pushes it through point
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
glorious. Goes full for the first time, and he gets punched down the ground. Middle and leg line. Again, front leg doesn't move too far forward. Bisects non-striker and the stumps there
well bowled. Late swing at a good length, aimed for middle. Defended off the inside half of the bat
offcutter, good length outside off stump, opens the face and dabs it to third man
good length at middle stump, drags this to deep point with a reverse sweep
good length, middle stump, conventional sweep from Waller. Deep square leg cleans up
good length at middle, pushed on the up to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
full at leg stump, driven to long-on

oh no, what have you done. Awful, awful shot from Waller. Raza can't believe it at the other end. Short ball, down leg side and he decides to take it on. Decides late. Cramps himself a bit, tries to put it too hard, lobs an easy one for Tharanga at deep midwicket. End of a crucial innings. He's brought Zimbabwe close to glory, but he'll be disappointed for giving Sri Lanka a sniff
back of a length in the corridor, punches it to sweeper cover's right
but he swings on into the pads. Full and on leg. Misses on the flick, leg bye to the keeper's left
back of a length at middle stump, solidly defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
good length, middle stump, driven to mid-off on the up
good length at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket on the up
good length outside off, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, spins back sharply and cramps him as he looks to cut
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length, flat outside off stump, hurriedly defended on the front foot
good length, off stump, blocked off the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended back down the pitch off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, swipes across the line and mistimes the pull to midwicket. Loose shot
slower ball, full outside off stump. Waits for it and opens the face to deflect it to third man
full and angled into the pads, calmly pushes this through midwicket, deep square has to run some distance to his left
full at off stump, solidly defends into the off side
good length, angled in at leg stump, overbalances and hits the flick in the air. But square leg is deep
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full outside off stump. Takes on the drive and gets it all wrong. Hard hands, away from the body, outside edge. Through the gap between slips and gully
full outside off stump, dug out to point...who misfields and gives away the run
short and wide, slight movement away off the pitch, beats him on the square cut. Raza hangs his head back, meditates
back of a length at middle stump, defended to the leg side off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, gets leg side of it and barely gets bat on this defence, very late
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, forward push into the off side
good length outside off, dips, turns sharply past the outside edge as he defends
goes for the sweep. Another one spins sharply from a length on off stump
good length, arm ball. Cremer struggling slightly. No clues about this. Inside edge on the forward push
good length at middle stump, defends with the bat close to pad
short of a length on off, jumps back to get on top of the bounce and knocks it through the gaps to deep backward point
short of good length, angling in on off, shuffles across and defends off the backfoot
good length, angled in on off, opens the face to run it to deep point
full and wide, crashes a drive square of the wicket and deep backward point runs to his right to pick it up
short ball, angled in at leg stump and going well over the shoulder of Cremer who barely has to duck
full, holding its line, left alone in the channel outside off
length ball, outside off, left alone
gets down to this slider and paddles it fine for a brace

oh, dear! That's another wicket gone to the wrong shot selection. Raza played so well and he has given it away with a poor shot. Gets down for a reverse sweep but this is a slider, loops up on middle and leg and refuses to turn. Just comes on with the arm to beat the bat and crash into the stumps. Raza walks off to a well-deserved ovation from his team-mates, and it's the 31st five-wicket haul for Herath in Tests
back of a length, pitching on middle and leg and turning away, shifts back and nudges it towards short leg
fullish length and straightens, Tiripano sticks the bat out without moving the feet and the ball goes off the inside edge and misses the stumps
full, on the stumps, comes forward and defends
slider on leg, Cremer gets down and sweeps to deep fine leg
short of a length, outside off, punched off the backfoot to deep backward point for one
full, angling in on off, crisply driven to mid-off
short of good length, outside off, rides the bounce and opens the face very late to stab it just wide of the second slip fielder
bouncer as expected, Tiripano ducks as the ball goes over his shoulder
short of a length on middle and leg, jumps back and nudges through square leg
fullish, angling in and straightening late to find the outside edge of Cremer who pushes forward, the ball goes well wide of the cordon and away to the third man boundary
comes on full and straight, nudged to midwicket
looped up on leg stumps, blocked towards short midwicket
length on middle and leg, tucked off the backfoot backward of square leg
advances down the ground, and look at that for placement.Gets right to the pitch and flicks it out through the region between mid-on and midwicket. Sweetly timed
length ball, sliding in on middle, turned away to short leg off the backfoot
fullish on middle and off, comes forward and defends back solidly
length ball on off, defended back
length, angling in on off, turned away towards midwicket
back of a length, angled in, tucked away to deep fine leg
full on the stumps, defended to mid-off
length ball on off, nudged away towards midwicket
fuller, chases it outside off and finds the inside edge of the bat as the ball drops into the leg side
fullish length and sliding in on leg, tries to move across and nudge it away but wears it on the pad
pitched up on middle and off, driven out to covers
advances down the track and meets the pitch of this one angling in on leg and smothers the spin
full, on middle, defended back
flighted up on off, driven to mid-off
looped up on middle, blocked quietly off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length, on the pads, deflected away to deep fine leg
just back of a length on off, opens the face of the bat and drops it into the vacant spaces at backward point. Cover jogs across and they take him on for a quick second
length ball on off, steered to gully with an open bat face
fuller ball on off, inside-edged into the pad as he defends with a straight bat
fullish length outside off, punched solidly with the full face of the bat to mid-off
back of a length, fired quicker on middle and leg, pushed back off the backfoot
loops one on middle and leg, comes on too straight and Cremer gets down for a sweep, barely gets a bottom edge as the ball goes fine
loopy fuller ball on leg, defended off the inside part of the bat to midwicket
fullish length, around middle and off this time, defended off the front foot
flat and full on middle, picks up the length and trajectory for a sweep through square leg
length, outside off, presses forward and defends off the outside part of the bat towards point
flat length ball, spinning in from middle, nudged away round the corner to fine leg
length, comes on with the arm outside off and finds the outside part of Cremer's bat as he defends
advances down and gets to the pitch before punching it hard straight back to the bowler
looped up outisde off, defended off the front foot
good length, spinning in, dabbed away to backward square leg
flat length ball, comes on quickly to him to leave him hurried as he tries to get back and tap it away, hits him on the pad but heading down leg
slider on leg and straightening, defended off the outside part of the bat
loopy fuller ball outside off, reaches out and drives it out gently to the right of deep backward point
advances down the ground and swings hard, ends up drilling it back off the inside part of the bat
full on middle and leg, blocked down the pitch
full on the stumps, defended
sliding on leg, nudged to forward short leg

edged and dropped. Tough chance for first slip but will go down as a missed one nonetheless. Cremer pushed forward to this fuller ball outside off and got a healthy outside edge that was dying on the fielder. Karunaratne is the one and the ball goes past his right
awkwardly fetches a sweep from middle and leg and does not middle it as the ball goes away behind square on the off side
advances down the track to keep the turn to a minimum and pushes it back to the right of the bowler
tossed up fuller ball outside off, defended into the covers
flat, spinning in from middle and leg, worked around the corner to deep fine leg
full and tight on off, comes forward and blocks
pitched up on middle and leg, defended back off the front foot
slider on middle and leg, defended to the right of the bowler
some turn there! Plays the angle as the ball comes on around middle but it spins away to find the outside edge and evade the first slip fielder
presses forward and pushes this out to mid-off
backs away to this short of a length ball and chops the cut
stays dangerously back to this length ball and manages to keep it out
full and wide outside off stump, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
goes for the yorker at off stump, defended on the full to extra cover
overpitched outside off stump, driven to extra cover with the toe-end
slower ball, good length and angled into the pads. Watches it closely and pokes it past short midwicket
good bouncer. Slanted in at off stump, arches away and lets it go
oh what a shot. Back of a length on middle stump. Goes deep in the crease, gets the front leg out of the way and whips it regally to the midwicket boundary
overpitched at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length, outside off stump. Pushes forward and beaten on the outside edge. Big gap between bat and pad. Watch out for the arm ball this over
good length, drifted in at off stump. Looks for the reverse sweep but the ball gets jammed between the bat and the pitch
arm ball. Good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at middle stump, steps out and fends after being beaten in flight, inside edge onto pad, but short leg had moved squarer
short ball in the corridor, climbs on top of it and defends into the off side
another short one, this is too high in the corridor. Lets it go comfortably
goes straighter with the bouncer, but it slants down leg. Leaps and tickles it off the thigh guard. Fine leg slides, in slow motion, to his right and cuts it off
bouncer aimed for the throat, too short, left alone
back of a length at leg stump, tucked to short midwicket
goes for the yorker, but it ends up a full toss. Swinging into the pads, easily flicked to fine leg
good length and drifted into the pad, pushed to short midwicket
drifts down leg side again, and this one goes on with the angle. And past the keeper and the flick. Runs away fine off the pad
overpitched outside off stump, can't get the drive past extra cover to his right
arm ball, good length and headed for off stump. Blocked out, very late
another arm ball, but a tad shorter. Pushed on the up to extra cover's left
good length at off stump, nicely forward to defend
good length, off stump, solidly defended into the off side
bouncer in the channel, too short, easily left alone
good length, into the pads, flicked away to fine leg's left
another bouncer. Potential for damage. 'Not now,' says Cremer. Ducks and sways and gets the bat away
good length and angled in at leg stump, defended solidly to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length, pitches outside leg, and finds Tiripano kicking it away
full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
uff. Tiripano is only just settling in. Hammers this sweep from leg stump, but straight to deep square
back of a length at off stump, punched to mid-off
full at leg stump, gets the bat on top of the sweep, can't get it past short fine
full at leg stump, defended off the front foot
dropped! Tossed up full outside off, steps out, gets to the pitch and bludgeons it straight to Kumara at mid-off and he gets himself in an awful tangle and can barely get his palms on it
good length outside off stump, defended into the off side
good length outside off, forward block
good length at off stump, steps out, taps it back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, turned to midwicket off the front foot
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
shifts back to this length ball that is slanted across on middle and defends
pitched up leg, and he sees the length early to charge down the track and loft it over mid-on. Clean blow
pitched up on leg, driven back to the bowler
back of a length, pitching outside leg, swivels and looks for a pull and makes no contact as the ball goes down the leg side
run out chance, safe in the end. Length, pitching outside leg, Tiripano tucks to midwicket and there is a slight hesitation on the single. Throw is at the keeper's end.Wrong end
short of a length, defended off the backfoot
overpitched outside off, looks to drill it through the off side. Jams it into the pitch and the ball spins away from the diving bowler. Mid-off fields

plumb. Tiripano was in a hurry. Back of a length at off stump. Looks to go deep and whip this into the leg side, unlike all the patience he has shown till then. Declaration around the corner, surely. A good knock from him, he's added bonus runs to Zimbabwe's target of 350 at the start of the day. Can't get bat on this in front of the stumps though
Tiripano didn't look like a No. 10, but Mpofu is out and out No. 11. Plays back to a length ball on off stump, thick inside edge to fine leg
full outside off, gets low and sweeps along the floor to deep square
back of a length, flat and fast outside off. No feet from Mpofu as he pokes at this. Falls over and Dickwella has used that window to flick the bails off. Sent upstairs. He's alright though. Not out
good length outside off, awkwardly lands the front leg outside off and defends with the inside edge
good length at leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the foot
ah, channels his Tiripano. Gets down for the paddle sweep from outside off. Quickly reduced to Mpofu. Can't get bat on it
good length at off stump, solidly blocked into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed into the leg side

good length, drifts in, dips and pitches on leg. Spins away from the bat and strikes his back thigh. Not out says the umpire. Review it, says Chandimal. Looked like it was going over. Let's see. No edge on it...looks to be a problem with the tracking. Hasn't showed up yet...ah there it is. And it confirms our suspicions. That was going over off stump
good length, arm ball at middle stump, defended comfortably into the leg side
full outside off stump, looks to dink it past slip with a reverse sweep, can't get bat on it
full outside off stump, steps out and chips to long-off...then takes the single
good length outside off, late on the forward defence but gets the outside edge and off strike
good length at middle stump, defended back down the pitch
good length at off stump, turned into the leg side with a flick
good length outside off stump, pushed it to long-on and won't take the single
full outside off stump, steps out and pokes it wide of long-off. Wants the second, but sweeper has come across quickly and it's only one. Nice work
length outside off, goes down and paddles it to deep square
length at off stump, defended off the front foot
length at middle stump, steps down the track and chips to long-on
ohh yessssss! Yes! Full at middle stump, waits for it to land and slaughters it over the midwicket boundary! Powerful
good length at middle stump, forward defence
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, steps out and can't get to the pitch. Looks to lift it over long-off, but it lands on the bounce in front of him
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length at middle, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot

that's the end. Good length at middle stump. Holds its line after sitting in the pitch and climbs on him as he looks to paddle it. Gets a glove that bobbles behind the keeper and slip is around to finish the catch and the innings
fullish length ball outside off, punched into the off side
short of good length, lets it spin away and punches it back
loops one up around off and it turns away, Karunaratne takes the front leg across and offers his pad
this one comes on with the arm from a back of a length and Karunaratne jams the bat down to defend
a little bit of width on offer outside off and Karunaratne backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
short of good length, moves across towards off to cover for the turn before punching to covers
comes right forward to meet the pitch of this fuller ball and pushes it out to mid-on
length ball, spinning in on middle and leg, defended
comes forward to this length ball and it bounces more than he expected as he wears it on the pad
tossed up on the stumps, bunted into the leg side
length, spinning in on off, stays back and defends off the backfoot with a straight bat
fuller, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
fuller, outside off, inviting the batsman forward as he defends into the off side
full and flighted outside off, gets a good stride forward and bunts it out
back of a length, spinning away, whips it against the turn from outside off towards mid-on
looped up outside off, comes forward and the ball takes extra turn as he defends off the outside part of the bat
pulls the length back a little this time and Tharanga waits on the backfoot to defend
length ball, tight line on off, not giving anything away here. Tharanga defends
slightly short of a length, rocks back and sticks the bat out to defend
comes down the track early and the bowler tucks him up with a length ball on middle and he is forced to awkwardly defend it at the very last minute
flat and short of a length, outside off, hangs back and defends
fuller ball, clipped off the pads to the right of deep midwicket
good length, spinning in from outside off, stays back and brings the bat down to defend
advances down the track to meet the pitch of this very full delivery and whips it away to deep midwicket
poor delivery. Short of a length and the batsman has enough time to rock back and swivel around with a powerful pull past the right of deep midwicket
length ball on middle and off, tucked off the pads to midwicket
fullish length, plants the front foot forward and drives it out to mid-off
fullish, defended off the front foot into the off side
loops one up outside off, no drift and comes on straight, Tharanga rocks back and stabs it to point
short of good length, not much turn outside off, hangs back and punches to point
backs away after seeing width but the ball bounces more and he can't really free his arms on the attempted cut, ends up patting it away hurriedly to point
very full ball, drilled hard straight back at the bowler
too much flight, full toss on leg stump and that's a gift for the batsman as he picks it up from the pads to gently whip it away through midwicket and mid-on
length ball, spinning in on off, defended back
length ball, spinning in on off, backs away and opens the face of his bat to drop it to the point region
spins in from slightly wide of off, backs away and punches it out to sweeper cover
shortish, not all that short but he has picked the length so early that he rocks back early enough and lays into a pull shot through mid-on
flighted outside off, defended
loopy fuller ball, pushes it out to covers off the front foot
full, outside off, carves it away to silly mid-off
flat ball, skids through and Tharanga brings the bat down in time to defend
full on off-stump, tries to drive and finds a thick outside edge that runs away to backward point
length ball, spinning in on leg, tucked off the pads to square leg
flat, comes on straight with the arm, Karunaratne is playing for the turn and gets beaten on the outside edge, misses off-stump quite narrowly too
defended in front of off
advances down the ground and carves a drive to long-on
loopy fuller ball outside off, comes forward and defends in front of the back pad
plants the front foot across on seeing the width outside off and the ball lobs in the air off the front pad
slider on leg, comes on full and it is clipped out to deep midwicket
short of a length and spinning away and that's well-played off the backfoot. Waits for it and opens the face very late to place it through backward point
lovely! Loops it up and gets it to land on a length, draws the batsman forward and gets it to rip past the outside edge
walks across to this fullish ball and lets it go outside off
shapes up for a cut but this ball does not bounce. Right line with the width but wrong length to be cutting, bottom-edged through the keeper's legs
pitched up on leg, defended down the pitch
some width and shortish, backs way and cuts it out to deep backward point
looped up outside off, stretches across and pads it away
short of a length, swivels around and pulls to deep midwicket
very full, outside off, gets down and across and paddles it away to deep fine leg
back of a length, spinning in around off, hangs back and tucks into the on side
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before whipping this fuller ball away to midwicket
looped up outside off, pushed back to the left of the bowler
full on leg stump, drops it in front of mid-on and they call right away for an extremely tight single.Good running
length, comes forward early and the ball takes some extra turn as he opens the face and defends later
very full slider on leg, drilled out to midwicket
flighted on middle, comes on with the arm and Tharanga, playing for the turn, pushes it back off the inside part of the bat
very tight and full on middle, defended down the pitch
slider across off and spinning in, tucked off the pads behind square. The throw from deep fine leg comes in but the keeper fumbles as he tries to flick it back. Sharp call for the second
length, spinning in on leg from middle, nudged to backward square leg
huge shout for lbw. Not given by umpire Ian Gould. Impact seemed ti be outside off. Tharanga got down to slog sweep this length ball that was slid across off
full, driven to mid-off
full again, defended to short leg
short of a length and spinning in sharply, keeps it out on the leg side
flighted on off, driven to long-off
low full toss on middle and leg, pushed back
skips down the track and drives this fuller ball to long-off
pitched up outside off, driven crisply to cover
shout for leg before, slipping down leg. Slider, does Karunaratne in with the drift and beats the inside edge to ping the pad
full, outside off, blocked
spinning in sharply from outside off, defended down the pitch
nicely looped up outside off, Tharanga takes a long stride forward to cover the turn and blocks
and again, right to the pitch of the ball as he throws his weight behind a drive to covers
sharp turn again, takes the inside part of the bat as Tharanga defends in front of middle
that's risky. Gets down for a paddle to this fuller ball and fetches it from outside off to work it to fine leg
comes down the track and closes the face of the bat early to this slider across off and pops a leading edge. The ball lobs to backward point but the fielder is deep and it saves him

length ball, comfortably beats the outside edge of Karunaratne who comes forward to defend. Zimbabwe have asked a question here and the umpires go upstairs to check if the backfoot had slid outside the crease. Nope, firmly inside
full and tight on middle, defended
drifting on middle and leg, Karunaratne comes down the track and whips to deep midwicket
back of a length, outside off, opens the face of his bat to punch it to point
length ball, the turn results in the ball taking the outside part of the bat as Tharanga defends
advances down the track to minimise the spin and drives to long-off
short of a length and width on offer, backs away and cuts to the right of sweeper cover
slid across outside off, defended off the inside part of the bat
length, spinning in, tucked behind square to fine leg. Brings up a crucial half-century opening stand
pushed across fuller outside off, goes hard at a drive and skews it towards mid-off off the inside part of the bat
bowled wide outside off, takes the front foot across and pads it away
flat length ball, spin sin viciously and gets big on him to hit him high on the thigh
flat, back of a length, backs away and cuts to point
flat, back of a length, gets up more than expected and he punches it out to sweeper cover
length, spinning away, stabbed to sweeper cover with an open bat face
full, spinning towards off, defended with bat close to pad on the front foot
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
length ball, spinning from leg,nudged to midwicket
looped up on leg, clipped through deep midwicket
pushed across outside off, whipped to deep midwicket
flat length ball, comes forward and did he keep his bat behind the pad? Yes, he did. That was off the pad.No appeal from Zimbabwe
fuller ball, driven back to the bowler
full, outside off, lobs to short leg off the pad
looped up outside off, pushes forward and plays down the wrong line. Hit on the pad but outside off
oh hello! Good length, flat and climbing quickly away from the outside edge as he fends at this
back of a length outside off stump, back foot punch to sweeper cover
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length, slung in at off stump,  forward defence
good length at off stump, pushed uppishly to cover point
dropped short at off stump, rocks back and smacks the life out of this. Straight to deep midwicket

got him! Tossed up from over the wicket, middle stump line. Rises on him as he looks to turn it into the leg side. Inside edge onto thigh guard, lobs to backward short leg. The good balls are coming rarely, but the field was perfect for this one
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover
naaaaaiiiiceee. Drifted in at a length outside off, turns away sharply. Good leave too

Shamshuddin, the TV umpire, examines various angles, but there is nothing behind the line. Surprising/shocking (delete by preference) decision from the TV umpire. Not out is the verdict. Zimbabwe's players are stunned, as is their coach Heath Streak in the change room. Lovely piece of bowling from Raza nonetheless. sliding in on middle this time, same length, defended down the pitch
length ball on middle and leg, presses forward and blocks
closes the face of the bat as he plays the angle. It's sliding in but straightens and finds the leading edge towards point
comes down the track to this length ball outside off and nudges it around to midwicket
length ball, sliding on middle and leg, tucked behind square
flighted on leg, defended back

shot! Poor delivery. Short and turning outside off so giving him the room he needs. Gunaratne lays into a pull and Musakanda runs to his right at deep midwicket and makes a brilliant save in front of the boundary
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
flighted and fullish on middle, defended
loops one up on leg stump and it is nudged past short leg between midwicket and square leg
gets a length ball to spin in sharply and keeps low, inside-edged behind square on the leg side as Dickwella brings the bat down
tries to take it away from the batsman and Dickwella walks across and sticks the bat out trying to force it away. COuld have edged to first slip
chases another one outside off and sticks the bat out to get beaten
and now the sweep. Length ball outside off, bounces over the bat and goes to the keeper
worked back to the bowler

dropped. Oh my god! Has Chakabva dropped the match? Dickwella comes forward and tries to flick across the line, from outside off as he closes the face. Ekes out a very mild edge and the keeper drops, the ball hits the grille of the keeper's helmet. Tries to take it on the rebound and can't take it. Oh,dear! You could sense a wicket was coming, and when the chance comes around finally, they don't take it
non-turner, left alone outside off
full toss outside off, pre-meditates a reverse sweep through cover-point
advances down the ground and squeezes this fuller ball back to the bowler

sweeps powerfull from outside off. Just how well has he played that shot today! Fullish, outside off, lays into it as it splits square leg and deep midwicket. Equation for SL down to less than 100 now
now Dickwella with the reverse sweep, not very well-middled and away to third man
back of a length, lets it go to the keeper from outside leg
another loopy flighted ball that pitches outside leg,padded away
very wide outside off, left alone
goes for another sweep and misses as the ball dips on him outside off. Gets over and past the left of the keeper and beats first slip diving to his right
goes for the risky flick from outside off and gets a leading edge through backward point
length ball, sliding down leg, and that's extremely well-played. Just guides it down to fine leg and the fielder at deep backward square leg runs across and just pulls it back
pitched up outside off, defended off the front foot

in the air and gets past the deep midwicket fielder diving to his left. Zimbabwe definitely under pressure. Gunaratne tries to pull this shortish ball and plays it in the air and deep midwicket dives to his left and the ball just gets past his hands, by inches
fuller ball, advances down the ground and drills it back. Some aggression from the captain, hurls the ball back in the direction of the batsman
loopy fuller ball outside off, takes a stride across and defends back
length, defended in front of off
short of a length and spinning in from outside off, waits for it do its thing and opens the face of his bat to third man
short ball, pitches outside leg and Gunaratne swivels around and pulls fiercely to deep midwicket
dipping full toss outside off, swept out to deep midwicket
comes down the track to mid-off and calls for a quick single. Direct hit missed at the non-striker's end but Dickwella would have been in anyway
pitched up outside off, driven towards extra cover
fullish length, slides in with the arm to take the inside edge of the bat and hit the pad
tucks this length ball off the pads to square leg
swept from outside off to deep midwicket
fuller, outside off, pushed out to mid-off
back of a length and spinning in, tucked off the hips to short fine leg
tapped to the leg side for a quick single
full on middle and leg, blocked back
ooh, mighty close. Fires a quicker length ball around off and Gunaratne gets an inside-edge close to the stumps as he punches
taps this ball gently outside off and the ball rolls towards slip off the outside part of the bat
flat and fullish outside off, carved out square of the wicket to deep point
low full-toss dipping outside leg, Asela can't tickle it away
floated up on middle and leg, defended back to Williams
full and outside off, non-turner, stretches out and pushes it back again
drifts in from wide of the crease, Asela now succeeds in tickling it to long leg though it was off the inside edge
Dickwella fetches this length ball from outside off and crisply sweeps it to deep midwicket
straighter one, which is calmly played back to the bowler off the front foot
full on middle, knocked through midwicket
length ball on off, worked away through midwicket
length ball, slides across the off stump, Asela stands tall and forces it to midwicket
floated up on middle, nudged to leg
angled across the off stump, opens the face and deliberately slices the ball through point
fractionally short and wide outside off, Dickwella jumps back and cuts it away square through the off side. They take two
short legbreak outside off, Asela jumps back and drags a pull to deep midwicket
slower through the air and outside off, Dickwella goes low, rolls his wrists, and sweeps it away to deep square leg
really full on of stump, driven away to the right of mid-on. Sensible batting
flat legbreak, starts outside off and spins back in, whipped through midwicket
flighted outside leg from around the wicket, dead-batted onto the pitch
Cremer lobs this one up well outside leg, Asela is simply happy to kick it away
skids on short and wide outside off, well past the tramline, no shot
Dickwella jumps back and nudges this from outside off to square leg
Williams tosses a full-toss outside leg, Asela drops down to one knee, rolls his wrists, and carefully sweeps it along the ground to deep square leg. He brings up a fighting fifty
spins in sharply from the rough outside off, hits the thigh

Dickwella ventures a reverse sweep and gloves it behind. Chakabva clings onto this chance. This was liberally tossed up outside off, breaks back in from the rough with extra bounce, foiling Dickwella's attempt to dink it away fine. Loops off the glove and Chakabva makes amends this time. Zimbabwe still have some hope. Dickwella falls for a career-best 81
arm ball from around the wicket, played back
full and slides in, inside-edged to short leg
nice dip on middle, dead-batted
floated up on leg stump, Asela prods it in the air to the left of diving short leg. Cremer sinks to his knees with the hands on his head
full on off, tight forward-defensive
speared down the leg side, past the bat, past the keeper for four byes.  Bonus runs for SL
slid through outside off, ignored
looped outside off, presses forward and drives solidly to cover, having met the pitch
nice and full on off, forward-defensive
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped away with the angle through square leg
Perera shimmies out, is nowhere close to the pitch, and ends up padding it away
short on the hips, Perera responds with a back-foot punch in the gap at square leg
slightly short on off, Asela manufactures room and chops it away to the right of point. Sweeper runs to his left to hunt it down
flighted outside leg, simply padded away
length ball, flat and fast, on middle, defended to short leg
rank half-tracker outside off, Perera jumps back and capably pulls it away to the left of deep midwicket
tossed on off, forward and smothered
a half-chance? lobs off the bat-pad, Moor at short leg dives to his left but can only finger-tip it away
dropped short and outside off, this is spanked straight to deep midwicket
Cremer finds dip and draws Asela out of the crease. Breaking down leg, the batsman misses, as does the keeper. Chakabva misses the stumping
length ball outside off, punched into covers
very full on off, defended quietly back
presses forward and the ball slides in with the arm to take the inside part of the bat as he defends
bit of a lucky boundary for Perera. Goes hard at a drive outside off and ekes it away through third man off the outside part of the bat. Zimbabwe losing it quickly now
length ball on off, confidently strides forward and bunts it out
beats his front-foot defence and hits him on the pad. Muted appeal for lbw, would have gone down leg with the angle
very full and flighted on off, defended
shifts back to this length ball and tucks it to the left of forward short leg
slides on middle and leg, nicely flighted, defended off the inside part of the bat
back of a length, heading towards leg, shifts back and bunts it out to square leg
gets down for a sweep to this fuller ball outside leg and not sure if he has got that off the middle. Not off the bat at all, in fact, as it runs away towards fine leg
slightly back of a length, and what a shot! That is a gem. Backs away to make himself some room and deftly opens the face of his bat to collect a four through third man
back of a length on the stumps, waits on the backfoot and whips it out to deep midwicket
floated up outside leg, offers his pad
sweeps this fuller ball outside leg and gets just a glove on it as backward short leg stops it
slightly short and Gunaratne swivels with a pull to deep backward square leg
length ball around off, comes forward and defends solidly
length ball, comes forward but realises it has pitched outside leg and so keeps the bat inside and lets it hit the pad
fuller on middle, pushed back
flat and short of a length, waits for it and punches off the backfoot through covers
very full on the stumps, defended off the front foot
back of a length, lets it spin and punches to covers
slightly shortish and he shifts back shaping up for a pull. But doesn't find the room he wants as the ball slides with the arm. Struck on the pad
sees mid-on inside the circle and steps down the track to loft this over and to the right of him. Not a very powerful shot, just a chip in the air
short of a length, pitching outside leg, swivels with a pull and gets a bottom edge as leg slip runs back and fields
too full and outside leg, does not bother putting the bat down and just lets it hit the pad
length ball, pitches outside leg and hits the pad as the batsman offers no stroke
gets down to meet the fuller ball on leg and sweeps to deep backward square leg
length ball, pitching outside leg, padded away
goes on the attack to this back of a length ball outside leg and gets into a bit of a tangle as he looks to whip it away. Hit high on the pad
is that an edge? Zimbabwe are going up confidently but umpire Gould is unmoved. And right call. Length ball, rips past the outside edge by mere inches.Phew! That was close
gets an inside edge to short leg as he plays down the wrong line
backs away to make some room and opens the face to point
beats him with another ripper! Length and a lot sharper turn so more comprehensively beaten
length, sharp turn away, keeps the bat inside the line
full on middle and off, driven to covers. Maiden from Cremer. Excellent over
that's another drop. Loops up and slants across one outside off and Perera chases it to get a thick outside edge. Chakabva is on the move and spills it
back of a length, whipped to midwicket
a tad shorter this time and he swivels around with a fierce pull to deep midwicket
yikes! Offers no shot to this looped up ball outside leg and it gets up to hit him painfully on the elbow
fuller, driven back to the bowler
fullish length outside off, defended
short of a length, backs away and slaps it out to sweeper cover
back of a length, defended into the off side off the backfoot
very full on leg, clipped away to midwicket
googly, not picked by the batsman as he comes forward and plays for the turn and wears it on the pad
punched to the right of sweeper cover
pitched up on leg, defended
back of a length and angled in on off, Perera presses forward and defends tightly
fuller than the previous ball outside off, driven to mid-off off the front foot
Perera stands tall, gets on top of this short ball outside off, and crisply punches through cover
full and angling into off and middle, Asela twirls his wrists and whips it away through square leg
Mpofu bangs this one into the middle of the pitch, lifter outside off, Perera evades it safely
another bumpy short ball outside off, Perera drops his wrists and watches it through to the keeper
starts on middle and spins down leg, no shot from Asela
very full and just a shade outside off, Asela collapses his back leg and drives inside-out to cover. Handsome stroke
non-turning legbreak on off, full, Asela is right forward to defend it
looped up on middle, another solid forward-defensive
tossed on off, can't break through this rock-solid forward-defensive
Cremer continues to lob it up, Asela continues to smother it off the front foot

Perera has a wry smile!  Proper bouncer on off, Perera, who is standing outside the crease, looks away, flings his hands up at the rising ball. The ball brushes the glove but lands in front of the keeper running in
short but not as short as the previous ball, Perera ducks under it
another lifter outside off, Perera lets it go again
follows three short balls with a length ball on off. Perera is concentrating, he reads the length, presses forward and defends watchfully to cover
back of a length on a sixth-stump line outside off, ignored
short and outside off, Perera leans back and chops it straight to cover
Cremer ventures around the wicket. Tossed outside leg, Asela pre-meditated a reverse sweep, lobs over slip off the glove band. Given as leg byes though
pushed through on leg stump, defended
turns after starting outside leg, blocked off the back foot
fired flat on leg, cramps Asela for room, she shovels it straight to short fine leg
lands it on leg stump, breaks on middle, Asela keeps it out
tossed-up legbreak, Asela plays back, plays across the line, and does not connect
back of a length and kicks up outside off, jabs it to point. The man at point tumbles and stops it
bouncer just outside off, Perera has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
short and rises outside off, Perera jumps off his feet and hastily fends to short midwicket
slower, full ball on off, offcutter at 119ks, Perera reads the variation and blocks it capably on the front foot

Cremer misses a direct hit but not by much! Pretty full on middle and leg from around the wicket, tapped to Cremer at short midwicket. Asela wants a single, but Perera doesn't. There is a mix-up, and eventually Perera sends his partner back. Cremer, though, can't nail the stumps down. He did not miss it by much. He covers his face up in a towel. Heartbreak for Cremer and Zimbabwe
Mpofy ventures another bouncer, Perera evades it

Oh my! What has happened here? Asela has smashed a pull into a ducking short leg. The keeper takes it on the rebound. The soft signal from umpire Gould is out. They refer it to the TV umpire. Replays show the pull pinged the left shin of Moor, hit the ground, then bounced up into the gloves of the keeper. Asela survives. The TV umpire gets it right this time
dropped short and outside off, Asela picks the length up quickly. Rocks back and pulls it flat and hard over a ducking short leg. There's no stopping Asela
good length on middle, tapped to the right of mid-on
short and breaks away outside off, chopped to cover
really full on off, dead-batted onto the pitch
gives it too much air and lobs up a full toss that is tucked away through backward square leg
short of a length, swivel pull off the backfoot through square leg
fuller, outside leg, swept to deep backward square leg
closes the bat face early and gets a leading edge that bounces in front of point
tucked to deep midwicket
full and down leg, swept to deep fine leg
pitching outside leg, swept to deep backward square leg

was there an inside edge? No, says Gould. Zimbabwe have reviewed. Back of a length googly, Perera stays back and brings the bat down hurriedly. Does not pick the variation and the ball cuts into him to hit him on the back thigh and lob towards the keeper. Could there have been a glove? They will stay with the on-field call unless there's substantial evidence to suggest otherwise. They cut to ball-tracking also to check the lbw. No issues there as it has missed the stumps by a mile. Right then, not out it is
length ball, looped up around leg and straightening, defended

huge appeal for lbw. Not out again, says the umpire. Zimbabwe have reviewed again. Seems like it pitched outside leg. It was a looped up flighted legbreak that spun back in to beat the inside edge as the batsman stayed back in the crease. Ball-tracking confirms it has not pitched in line
just back of a length, spinning away from around leg, defended to short leg
very full on middle and off, blocked back off the front foot
gets down to sweep and misses as the ball goes down the leg side, well past the leg stump
pitched up on leg, defended off the front foot
flighted outside leg, swept to fine leg
pads this flighted delivery away as it lands outside leg
pitching outside leg, pads it away
gets down for a big sweep from outside leg and lobs it in the air off the top edge, evades leg slip
tossed up outside leg, swept to long leg
keeps a little low around off, jams the bat down and defends
tries a hurried punch off the backfoot, no room and he gets beaten and the ball misses off stump closely
front foot defence down the pitch
short and wide and a little flat, cuts off the backfoot and chops it to covers
poor delivery. Short and spinning away and giving him all the room he wants and he swivels with a powerful pull between deep midwicket and long-on
pitches outside leg, tries to tuck but pulls his bat out late
short of a length, pulled straight to deep midwicket. Just the one. Scores level
brings out the sweep but the ball pitches outside leg and he makes no contact
pitches outside leg and hits him on the pad as he comes forward to defend
full on middle and leg, defended
fuller outside off, driven through covers, and that seals it
